title: Outside Sales Representative
description:
This is an excellent opportunity for a proactive professional eager to make an impact across various sectors, including Mechanical Contracting, General Contracting, Construction, Property Management, Healthcare, Industrial Accounts, and IT. This role involves developing and implementing sales strategies to penetrate new markets while maintaining and nurturing existing relationships. You will conduct direct sales calls and presentations to targeted customer segments across the designated market area, collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver tailored solutions that meet client needs.

**Compensation and Benefits**

* Competitive salary with an unlimited commission structure
* Take-home company vehicle
* Provided technology tools including phone and computer
* Expense account for business-related costs
* Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance
* Life Insurance
* 401k plan with company match
* Paid time off (vacation, sick leave, and holidays)
* Career development opportunities
* Employee discount programs

**Why you should apply for this position today**

This role offers a chance to make a significant impact in multiple industries while achieving your sales objectives. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment where your contributions are recognized and rewarded. You will engage with clients and provide expert insights, enhancing your career growth in the process.

**Skills**

* Strong understanding of HVAC and electrical systems, including their functionalities
* Excellent communication and negotiation abilities, both verbal and written
* Mechanical aptitude and proficient problem-solving skills
* Strong organization and follow-through skills
* Demonstrated leadership qualities and a goal-oriented mindset
* Proficiency in Excel, Windows, Outlook, CRM systems, and other relevant software
* Competitive drive and a commitment to achieving sales objectives

**Responsibilities**

* Develop and implement sales strategies to penetrate new markets
* Maintain and nurture existing client relationships
* Conduct direct sales calls and presentations to targeted customer segments
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver tailored client solutions
* Maintain accurate records of sales activities, pipeline status, and market trends
* Engage in ongoing product training and stay updated on industry developments

**Qualifications**

* 3-5+ years of proven success in Outside Sales, preferably within the HVAC or industrial rental market
* Valid driver’s license with a clean driving record
* Ability to successfully pass pre-employment background and drug screenings
* Willingness to spend 90%+ of time in the field engaging with clients
* Experience in commercial and/or industrial product sales

**Education Requirements**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Technical, Marketing, Business, or a related field preferred

**Education Requirements Credential Category**

* Degree in Engineering, Technical, Marketing, Business, or a related field preferred

**Experience Requirements**

* At least 3-5 years of relevant experience in Outside Sales
* Proven experience in the HVAC rental industry is highly desirable

**Why work in South Plainfield, NJ**

South Plainfield offers a strong sense of community while being conveniently located near major metropolitan areas. This location provides access to a variety of amenities, including shopping, dining, and recreational activities. The area is known for its diverse business landscape and opportunities for professional networking, making it an ideal place for career growth.

Employment Type: Full-Time

Salary: $30000.00 - 130000.00 Per Year

Education Level: Bachelor's degree

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Sales in HVAC or Manufactring: 3 years (Required)
* CRM software: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* South Plainfield, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 100% (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Overnight Veterinary Technician
description:
Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital is an AAHA accredited 10-doctor practice located in a modern, state of the art facility in Oakhurst, NJ.


Veterinary Technicians are a vital part of Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital. Technicians are responsible for patient care and assisting the doctors in providing outstanding medical care to our patients.


We are looking for hard-working, self-motivated individuals to join our amazing technician team! We are currently hiring both full and part time overnight technicians. We offer a competitive salary plus overnight pay differential. Generous benefit packages are available for full time staff members. Experience in the veterinary field is required. Our Veterinary Technicians work both independently and side by side with our doctors. Technicians must have excellent communication and customer service skills. We utilize electronic medical records, so computer skills are a must. Experience with Impromed Infinity preferred but not required.


Overnight technicians are responsible for monitoring and documenting all patients and animal activity in the hospital (including kennel area) and completing treatments on hospital patients at scheduled times. Must be capable of handling critical patients in an emergency situation and relaying information to the doctor on-call. Must have experience using oxygen/anesthesia machines and various monitoring equipment. Overnight technicians are expected to maintain a clean work environment and participate in facility maintenance (routine cleaning, etc.) during their shift.


Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital is a Fear-Free practice and utilizes techniques to make our patients’ visits as stress and anxiety free as possible. Our entire staff is committed to this goal.


Job Types: Full-time, Part-time


Experience:

* Veterinary Technician: 1 year (Required)

  


Available shifts and compensation: We have available shifts all days of the week. Compensation depends on your experience.


About Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital: Today, our commitment to clients and to veterinary excellence is stronger than ever. With a devoted and enthusiastic staff, we enjoy an outstanding reputation for providing pets and their owners with the very best in compassionate pet health care. Learn more about us at https://www.oakhurstvet.com.

title: Event Emcee - Game Night Host - Manhattan, NY Region
description:
RezEvents is now hiring Game Night Event Hosts / Emcee for in person game night events! This is a fun, flexible gig that is perfect for a motivated event host, actor, comedian or personable performer.

Do you enjoy game nights? Fun Personalities encouraged to apply!

**About the Gig:**

RezEvents team of Game Night Hosts are ready to entertain any party. The Game Night Event Host is responsible for leading a fun game night for groups. Currently, we are looking to hire Trivia Game Night and BINGO Game Night hosts to our crew.

Events are held at various food & beverage venues in the region. Our goal is to entertain the guests and help build a great community of players. The Game Nights are live-hosted in person events best suited for persons with experience in live production and performance.

**Responsibilities:**

* Operate Trivia or BINGO web application to manage game play (training provided)
* Connect laptop computer to venue’s Audio/Video for in-person game nights
* Make Announcements over P/A system to welcome players and run game
* Simultaneously conduct game while entertaining guests
* Provide post-event wrap-up to the RezEvents home-base
* Be a great Ambassador for the RezEvents team

**Requirements:**

* Must have reliable laptop computer to run the game with the following requirements:
* HDMI connection port or adapter for Video
* Bluetooth for Audio
* Previous experience with Audio & Video equipment is preferred

**Other Requirements:**

* Must be 21+
* Have reliable transportation

**Job Type:** Contract

**Salary:** $75 per event

**Physical setting:**

* Restaurant, Brewery, or Bar location.

**Schedule:**

* Game Night Events occur weekly at locations
* Weekday Evening events are most common
* Events typically last ~2-2.5 hours
* Substitute Host positions available as well (On Call Host)

**Supplemental pay types:**

* Varies per location

**About RezEvents:**

RezEvents makes events easy and fun! Our Interactive Game Nights are great for groups of any size. RezEvents offers a variety of virtual & in-person events to entertain and engage your group.

RezEvents is excited to offer Leaderboard Games - Trivia and BINGO Game Nights! Providing interactive, live-hosted entertainment for restaurants, bars, and breweries across the US.

—

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $25.00 - $32.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Evening shift

Application Question(s):

* What event hosting, emcee, or other performance experience do you have?
* What experience with A/V (audio/video) do you have? What kind of laptop computer do you have?
* Why did you apply to be a game night event host with us?

Shift availability:

* Night Shift (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10007: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Receptionist
description:
Client Service Representatives (CSR) provide the first and the last impression of each client’s visit to our hospital. CSRs are responsible for client care and communication.
  
  

Our customer service representatives work together to greet pet owners, check-in and admit pets to the hospital, prepare medical records, receive and post payments, submit Trupanion claims, schedule and confirm appointments, respond to owner inquiries, process referrals, interact with referring veterinarians, staff doctors, specialists and technicians and perform various other tasks that include: Maintaining a professional, cheerful and helpful attitude when interacting with clients. Answering incoming telephone calls using proper telephone etiquette as defined by Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital. Welcome clients and patients to the hospital, check in patients using the process designed by Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital. Monitor the length of time clients are waiting, and appropriately handle these situations. Schedule appointments and surgical procedures for a busy 12 doctor practice. Accurately process payments which includes, cash, credit cards, checks and Care Credit. Assist the team in keeping the hospital clean and clear of odors. Hours needed vary, but can include days, evenings and weekends.
  
  

**Available shifts and compensation:** We have available shifts all days of the week. Compensation is $16.00 - $20.00/hour.
  
  

**About Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital:** Today, our commitment to clients and to veterinary excellence is stronger than ever. With a devoted and enthusiastic staff, we enjoy an outstanding reputation for providing pets and their owners with the very best in compassionate pet health care. Learn more about us at https://www.oakhurstvet.com.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description:
Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital is an AAHA accredited 12-doctor practice located in a modern, state of the art facility in Oakhurst, NJ.
  
  

Veterinary Technicians are a vital part of Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital. Technicians are responsible for patient care and assisting the doctors in providing outstanding medical care to our patients.
  
  

We are looking for hard-working, self-motivated individuals to join our amazing technician team! Full time (34-40hrs/wk) or part time hours are available. Hours include mornings, nights and weekends. Overnight hours are available as well. Must be reliable and responsible. Offering great starting hourly salary and generous benefit packages (must be full time). We are currently in need of technicians WITH EXPERIENCE (1-3 years preferred) in the veterinary field. Our Veterinary Technicians work both independently and side by side with our doctors. Technicians must have excellent communication and customer service skills. We utilize electronic medical records, so computer skills are a must. Experience with Impromed Infinity preferred but not required.
  
  

Our Veterinary Technicians perform various roles such as Exam Room Technician, Treatment Room Technician, and Surgery Technician. Technician responsibilities include obtaining history from clients, assisting in exam rooms, client education, venipuncture, IV catheter placement, SQ/IV/IM injections, obtaining digital radiographs, performing treatments as directed by the doctors, preparing samples to be sent to outside laboratories, and performing in-house bloodwork. Technicians also prepare patients for surgery, intubate, monitor anesthesia, perform dental cleanings and obtain digital dental radiographs.
  
  

Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital is a Fear-Free practice and utilizes techniques to make our patients’ visits as stress and anxiety free as possible. Our entire staff is committed to this goal.
  
  

If you are interested in joining our amazing team and have a true love for animals please provide a resume or email our Technician Manager Cat directly at ckath@oakhurstvet.com
  
  

**Available shifts and compensation:** We have available shifts all days of the week. Compensation is $17.00 - $22.00/hour.
  
  

**About Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital:** Today, our commitment to clients and to veterinary excellence is stronger than ever. With a devoted and enthusiastic staff, we enjoy an outstanding reputation for providing pets and their owners with the very best in compassionate pet health care. Learn more about us at https://www.oakhurstvet.com.

title: Animal Caretaker
description:
Must love and be comfortable around animals and their owners.
  
  

Looking for Full & Part time employment. Nights and weekends required. Experience is welcome but not required, as we will train fully. Employee benefits and pet benefits available.
  
  

We are open 7 days a week. Pet Hotel employees work mornings and evenings. Day shifts can start as early as 6am, evening shifts end as late as 10pm.
  
  

Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital is an AAHA accredited 11-doctor practice located in a modern, state of the art facility in Oakhurst, NJ.
  
  

The OVH Pet Hotel provides a safe, clean, fun and fear free environment for pets while their owners are away. Pet Care Technicians are responsible for:
  
  

Admitting & discharging boarders, feeding, cleaning, completing activities (leash walks, play times, etc.), bathing, assisting Veterinary Technicians and Doctors, and administering medications.

title: Pharmacy Technician
description:
Pharmacy Technicians are a vital part of Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital. Pharmacy Technicians are responsible for dispensing medications as well as supplies for the hospital in order to maintain excellent veterinary care. Experience is preferred. Our Pharmacy Technician team works together with doctors to dispense medications and also interacts closely with our clients to explain all medications thoroughly.
  
  

Our Pharmacy team performs various tasks such as filling medications for clients and hospital patients, educating clients on medications and answering any questions asked, filling out medication request forms and getting approval by doctor for refills, accurately noting communications and medication information in each patient’s medical record, educating clients on heartworm/flea & tick preventatives and various other tasks that include: Answering incoming telephone calls using proper telephone etiquette as defined by Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital. Maintaining accurate medical records. Accurately process payments which includes, cash, credit cards, checks, submitting Trupanion claims, and Care Credit. Maintain online refill requests for clients and patients. Schedule appointments for exams and bloodwork as needed patients. Dispensing supplies for hospital.
  
  

**Available shifts and compensation:** We have available shifts all days of the week. Compensation depends on your experience.
  
  

**About Oakhurst Veterinary Hospital:** Today, our commitment to clients and to veterinary excellence is stronger than ever. With a devoted and enthusiastic staff, we enjoy an outstanding reputation for providing pets and their owners with the very best in compassionate pet health care. title: On- Call House Staff
company: The Archdiocese of New York - Central Services
description:
**Overview/Purpose:**

This position is a part-time, on-call guest services position within the Sheen Center front-of-house operations area. Assignments will be in multiple areas and may include work at the front desk, box office, concessions or serving as an event attendant or usher. A key focus of this hybrid position is to help shape an exceptional guest experience for patrons following established Sheen Center guidelines.

**Work Location:** 18 Bleecker Street, New York, NY 10012

**Reports to:** Patron Services Manager

**Responsibilities:**

* Greet patrons to the facility and provide appropriate direction to seats in the theatres or other rooms in the facility.
* Answer phones providing basic information about shows and facilities and directing calls as appropriate depending on daily assignment.
* Perform basic office functions as needed depending on daily assignment.
* Sell and process tickets, studio rentals, and/or concession items depending on daily assignment.

**Education, Experience, and Skills:**

* A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field is preferred, but not required.
* Equivalent work experience with an arts venue or experience working in the customer/guest services industry.
* Proficiency with MS Office products required. Experience with Point of Sale and AudienceView ticketing software systems preferred.
* Ability to multi-task and have exemplary interpersonal communication, phone and guest services skills.
* Must have positive professional attitude and appearance.
* Ability to work independently as well collaboratively as part of a team.
* Be in strong alignment with Sheen Center mission and goals.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with flexible hours including required nights and weekends. Assignments may include light lifting up to twenty-five pounds and standing for long periods.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.50 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 29 per week

Benefits:

* 403(b)
* Flexible spending account

Schedule:

* On call
* Weekends as needed

title: Contract Specialist / Paralegal
description:
**Job Title: Service Contracts Team Coordinator**

**Duration: 14+ Months**

**Location: Princeton, NJ (08540)**

**Shift: 8:30 am – 5 pm**

**Notes:**

* Manage incoming product support contract requests.
* Light prospecting, client order research, Scheduling
* Detailed oriented, follow up skills
* Proficient in MS Office
* Looking for someone that is looking to grow into a sales career
* Degree in Biology or Sciences preferred
* Good Written and Verbal communication
* Great Customer Service

**Major Requirement: Exp. with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel), Adobe, excellent verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities.**

**Summary**:

* The Service Contracts Team Coordinator is responsible for monitoring the Service Agreements Inbox, assigning requests to Service Contracts Team Members, researching various aspects of new and existing Service Contracts, billing/pricing issues and other administrative tasks.
* This role will work in an office environment based in our Princeton, New Jersey headquarters.

**Main responsibilities:**

* Provide administrative support to the Service Contract Team for moderately complex elements of Client's Service Contract program.
* Responsible for coordinating the intake of Service Contract requests from Service Agreement Inbox from various departments within APOC and other Client Divisions.
* The role is responsible for assigning requests to the appropriate Service Contracts Team Member
* Researching existing contracts and medical device serial numbers, resolving billing questions and other data points.
* Verify Billing on a weekly basis.
* Process Credit/rebills.
* Sending out W9/Source letters by email
* Creating team monthly schedule
* Sending Reps RGA History as requested
* Handle request Contract & Pricing for Client Owned Equipment (AOE)
* Checking voice messages left for the team/return calls.
* Notes taking for team meetings.
* Able to use various Client Systems (SAP, QAD, ISS, SMS, etc.)
* Composes straightforward written correspondence at the direction of the Service Team.
* Manages and coordinates various projects as needed on a daily basis.
* Performs general administrative duties as assigned.
* Complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments. Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors.
* Other duties as assigned, according to the changing needs of the business.

**Education**:

* Associate or bachelor’s degree in a business-related discipline or equivalent work experience.

**Experience/background:**

* Minimum 2 + years’ experience directly related to contract sales and administrations, preferably within the biotech/healthcare industry.
* Demonstrated organizational skills, attentiveness to detail, ability to work under general
* supervision and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* Demonstrated exceptional interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills,
* including the ability to listen, resolve moderately complex problems, deal with
* unresolved issues, delays, and unexpected events, while effectively communicating and
* maintaining rapport with Customers, and Sales Representatives,
* Demonstrated proficiency in operating a personal computer. Minimum intermediate Word
* and Excel experience a must (Advanced proficiency with MS Office preferred)
* Strong analytical ability, originality and ingenuity required. The demonstrated ability to
* enter and retrieve data quickly is also required.
* Must have the knowledge and ability to extract data from multiple information systems on an ad-hoc basis.
* Strong organizational and follow-up skills, as well as attention to detail. Must have customer service attitude.
* Self-motivated - Out of the box thinker; positive attitude, passion for quality and delivery
* and excellence. Ability to maintain regular and predictable attendance.
* Ability to work in a high volume, fast-paced, dynamic team environment
* Ability to leverage and/or engage others to accomplish projects.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $28.00 - $31.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Education:

* Associate (Preferred)

Experience:

* Contract negotiation: 3 years (Preferred)
* Pharma/biotech/healthcare industry.: 3 years (Preferred)
* Sending out W9/Source letters by email: 3 years (Preferred)
* Handle request Contract & Pricing: 3 years (Preferred)
* Contract management: 3 years (Preferred)
* contract agreements: 3 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Princeton, NJ 08540 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Info & Småland Co-worker (12-20 hours per week)
description:
### **Why we will love you**


A job at IKEA is so much more than home furnishings. Together, we work to make a better everyday life for the many. It's the perfect fit if you want to contribute, grow, and share your uniqueness. Join our team and start a better life for yourself.


### **What you'll be doing day to day**


At IKEA, we are a very family-friendly retailer, that's why we offer IKEA Småland, a place for kids to have fun while our customers shop on their own. As a Children’s Activity Area Associate, you will: Contribute to creating a pleasant and safe environment for the children that visit our play facility. Register children, monitor and entertain children while in the playroom, and maintain a clean and hygienic environment. Participate in the planning and execution of children’s activities both in and outside of Småland. Build meaningful and empathetic relationships with children and their caretakers. Strictly adhere to all IKEA play facility and safety & security policy and procedures. Support in other areas of the customer experience function as needed, such as cashier and greeter role to provide additional coverage when needed.


### **Together as a Team**


At IKEA it’s all about our customers, and in Customer Relations we build and retain long-lasting relationships with new and existing customers in a multichannel retail environment. We’re a diverse team that work together to ensure a positive and joyful experience for all IKEA visitors and customers: we set up services, gather feedback and make things right! Our modus operandi is to connect to people by listening to their personal needs and to create genuine interactions. We’re a bunch of people who are truly passionate about people!


### **QUALIFICATIONS**


Experience in retail or childcare preferred. CPR and First Aid certification training provided. Requirements Physical Demands: Lifting and Carrying Occasionally (1-25lbs)
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Carts Attendant (34-40 hours per week)
description:
### **Why we will love you**


A job at IKEA is so much more than home furnishings. Together, we work to make a better everyday life for the many. It's the perfect fit if you want to contribute, grow, and share your uniqueness. Join our team and start a better life for yourself.


### **What you'll be doing day to day**


As a Retail Carts Co-worker ensuring an enjoyable shopping experience for our customers, you will: Provide friendly and efficient car loading and/or unloading services while keeping the loading zone clean by clearing away straps, excess carts, and cardboard. Ensure that all physical shopping tools, including carts, pencils, yellow bags, maps, and twine, are adequately stocked and maintained throughout the store during business hours. Ensure physical shopping tool are filled at closing. Monitor the condition of physical and digital shopping tools, report any IT issues, and remove any physical stands or tools that are unsafe. Address customer needs, resolve issues independently, escalate matters to a manager when needed. Support in other customer service areas such as Full Serve Hand Out (FSHO), Exchanges & Returns, Click & Collect as needed. When supporting in Full Serve Hand Out (FSHO), provide customers with a simple and efficient handout experience. When supporting in Returns, ensure products and equipment are properly staged. When supporting Click & Collect, create a positive customer experience by ensuring accurate order handoff. Contribute to an environment where the IKEA culture is a strong and living reality that embraces the diversity of co-workers and customers.


### **Together as a Team**


At IKEA it’s all about our customers, and in Customer Relations we build and retain long-lasting relationships with new and existing customers in a multichannel retail environment. We’re a diverse team that work together to ensure a positive and joyful experience for all IKEA visitors and customers: we set up services, gather feedback and make things right! Our modus operandi is to connect to people by listening to their personal needs and to create genuine interactions. We’re a bunch of people who are truly passionate about people!


### **QUALIFICATIONS**


Physical Demands: Lifting up to 50lbs and walking frequently. Working Conditions: Outdoor 50% of the time.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Driver
description:
Since 1994, SPORTIME has been proud to operate the finest tennis and sports facilities in New York State. SPORTIME has 15 facility locations, most recently adding the iconic Port Washington Tennis Academy, now SPORTIME Port Washington, the largest indoor racket sports facility on Long Island. SPORTIME currently offers 194 indoor and outdoor tennis courts and 70 pickleball courts, as well as rinks, turf, camps, gyms and more, at sites across Long Island, in NYC, in Westchester and in the NY Capital Region. SPORTIME clubs are state-of-the-art, yet affordable, and feature the best tennis, sports and fitness facilities and programs, including the John McEnroe Tennis Academy and SPORTIME Volleyball Club). SPORTIME clubs serve individuals of every age and athletic ability, 365 days a year.  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* To provide a first class transportation experience for our members to and from our facility
* To act in a professional and courteous manner at all times
* Make sure that students are secured in their seat belts prior to the trip departure
* Follow safety rules as students are boarding and exiting buses including any applicable COVID guidelines
* Check the conditions of the vehicles tires, brakes, windshield wipers, lights, gas, and oil to ensure that everything is in working order
* Comply with traffic regulations in order to operate the vehicle in a safe manner
* Regulate, air, heating, lighting, and radio controls for passenger comfort
* Reporting of all accidents, delays, or unusual circumstances to the appropriate management personnel in a timely manner
* Maintenance of a clean van (Interior and Exterior)
* Turn in and initial receipts for all gas purchases
* Maintain a log for EZ Pass utilization.
* Immediately reporting of all driver infractions on or off the job.

**WORK CONTEXT/ACTIVITIES:**

* The position requires the employee to be pleasant with others on the job and display a good-natured, cooperative attitude
* The position requires the employee to lead by example, delegate, communicate, train, follow up and deliver feedback to respective team employees.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES**

* Valid current Driver’s license with clean driving record
* Minimum of 18 months driving experience
* Knowledge of driving vehicles in NYC
* Ability to operate vehicles with multiple passengers of all ages
* Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify problems, create solutions and apply solutions
* Ability to use independent judgement and decision making
* Ability to sit and stand for long periods of time
* Ability to bend, stretch, twist, or reach with your body, arms and/or legs
* Ability to lift and carry up to 20lbs
* Developing constructive and cooperative work relationships with others and maintaining them over time
* Strong communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills

**SCHEDULE** : Full-time, Monday - Friday

**SALARY:** $18.00 - $22.00 per hour

**BENEFITS**

**Member benefits -** Employees receive complimentary Sportime membership and are eligible to use club facilities, including tennis, fitness and sports, to participate in club programs on a complimentary or discounted basis, and to receive discounts on retail and other purchases.

**Health, dental and vision insurance -** Full-Time employees are eligible to enroll in Sportime’s group health, dental and vision insurance plans on the first day of the month after they have worked 60 days. Premiums are deducted pre-tax from employees’ gross pay; Sportime contributes to the premiums of employees based upon gross pay thresholds.

**401k with Employer Match -** SPORTIME EMPLOYEES are eligible to enroll in our SPORTIME Retirement plan after they have completed 1 year of service consecutively, worked at least 1000 hours in a calendar or anniversary year and are over 21 years old.


SPORTIME CLUBS, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran, or status in any group protected by applicable federal, state or local law.


Note to Recruiters and Placement Agencies: SPORTIME CLUBS, LLC does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any employee. SPORTIME CLUBS, LLC will not pay fees to any third party agency or firm and will not be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Unsolicited resumes from Recruiters or Placement Agencies will not be accepted by SPORTIME CLUBS, LLC and will be processed accordingly.

title: ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF PSYCHOLOGY
description:
The Assistant Director of Psychology reports to the Director of Psychology. This person is responsible for the oversight of all agency Behavior Intervention Specialists and implementation of Psychology services in all assigned OPWDD programs. Salary range to be offered will be based on degree, certifications and years of experience: $73,000 - $75,000 plus a comprehensive benefits package with eligibility on your first day of hire.

title: Landscape Maintenance Manager
description:
**Job Summary:** The Landscape Maintenance Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing QE Solar’s landscape maintenance activities for utility-scale and C&I Solar/BESS projects across the US. The Landscape Maintenance Manager will ensure that the landscape maintenance crews perform their tasks in a safe, efficient, and professional manner, in compliance with QE Solar's standards and contractual obligations. The Landscape Maintenance Manager will also coordinate with other departments, such as Field Operations, Engineering, and Commercial Assets to ensure the optimal performance and reliability of the Solar/BESS plants.  

**Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities (%)*** Manage and supervise the landscape maintenance crews, including hiring, training, scheduling, evaluating, and disciplining. (40%)
* Develop and implement landscape maintenance plans, procedures, equipment procurement & maintenance plans, and best practices for each Solar/BESS project, in accordance with QE Solar's policies and contractual requirements. (20%)
* Monitor and inspect the quality and safety of the landscape maintenance work and provide feedback and corrective actions as needed. (15%)
* Prepare and maintain landscape maintenance records, reports, and budgets, and ensure timely and accurate invoicing and billing. (10%)
* Communicate and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders, such as project managers, site managers, engineers, clients, vendors, and regulators, to ensure the smooth operation and maintenance of the Solar/BESS plants. (10%)
* Stay updated on the latest industry trends, technologies, and regulations related to landscape maintenance for solar projects, and provide recommendations for improvement and innovation. (5%)
  

**Knowledge** Knowledge of: landscape maintenance principles, practices, and techniques for utility-scale and C&I Solar/BESS projects – or – commercial landscaping/mowing experience with other renewables, commercial projects of scale, or generally large projects that contain sophisticated or specialized equipment; safety and environmental regulations and standards for landscape maintenance; budgeting, accounting, and financial management for landscape maintenance.  

**Skills** Skills in: Managing and leading landscape maintenance crews and projects; planning, organizing, and coordinating landscape maintenance activities and resources; monitoring, inspecting, and evaluating landscape maintenance work and quality; problem-solving, troubleshooting, and decision-making for landscape maintenance issues and challenges; communication, negotiation, and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders; computer software and applications for landscape maintenance management and reporting; sense of urgency; regular communications; consistent follow-up.  

**Abilities** Ability to: work independently and as part of a team; work under pressure and meet deadlines; adapt to changing priorities and situations.
  

**Physical Requirements** Lift, carry, and operate landscape maintenance equipment and tools. Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time. The ability to observe details at close range (within a few feet of the observer). Ability to lift equipment up to 50lbs.
  

**Working Conditions** Work outdoors in various weather and terrain conditions; The ability to operate machinery, work in noisy environments, or have close visual acuity  

**Required Education** High school diploma or equivalent.  

**Preferred Education** Bachelor's degree in horticulture, landscape management, or related field.  

**Required Experience** Three years of experience in landscape maintenance for commercial landscaping/mowing experience with other renewables, commercial projects of scale or generally large projects that contain sophisticated or specialized equipment. One year of experience in supervising and managing landscape maintenance crews and projects.
  

**Preferred Experience** Five years of experience in landscape maintenance for utility-scale and C&I solar projects. Three years of experience in supervising and managing landscape maintenance crews and projects.  

**Required Certifications, Licensures, Etc.** Valid driver's license  

**Preferred Certifications, Licensures, Etc.** Certified Landscape Professional (CLP) by the National Association of Landscape Professionals (NALP). Certified Landscape Technician (CLT) by the Professional Landcare Network (PLANET).  

  

Ability to Relocate:* Springfield, NJ: If not local, candidate must relocate before starting work (Required)

* Perks at Work Marketplace for discounts on gym memberships, classes, tech, vacations, tickets, and more
* Family Building and Adoption Assistance Programs
* Learning & Development Opportunities

title: Project Manager
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW:**  

  

Sampled enables clients to advance human health by leveraging active biological samples through preservation, immortalization and utilization in comprehensive multiomics research within the only leading-edge Global Integrated Analytical Biorepository.  

  

Sampled is committed to building a sustainable, inclusive and diverse culture where team members enjoy equal opportunities in a safe, supportive and empowering environment. Sampled believes that as an organisation we have a duty to be actively engaged in supporting not just the clients and industries we serve but the communities where we live and work.  

  

**POSITION SUMMARY:**  

  

The Project Manager plans, oversees, and manages projects at Sampled that are critical to the function and success of the business. Supports and maintains exceptional client satisfaction and business performance metrics.  

  

This position will be based at Sampled's Headquarters in Piscataway, New Jersey.  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:*** Proactively manage multiple or large complex projects ensuring project requirements and desired outcomes are met, and are aligned with company strategy, commitments and goals. Create and maintain accurate project plans using appropriate project management tools.
* With support from the Senior Project Manager, perform data analysis and reporting for existing and future projects based on forecast information.
* Organize both internal and external meetings with key stakeholders to ensure project success.
* Develop and maintain good working relationships with internal peers and external partners.
* Work with internal and external stakeholders to manage project deliverables, e.g. CMO’s, Supply Chain.
* Lead the development of the integrated project plan (timeline, milestones, and deliverables) in collaboration with cross-functional stakeholders. Project plans must be maintained for accuracy.
* Play a critical role in helping the team identify project risks, understanding their impact and implementing mitigation strategies. Responsible for providing support to lab units in a dynamic capacity given project deadlines.
* Assists management and directors in preparation of contract and grant proposals, progress reports, and developing budgeting and cost allocation information.
* Interfaces closely cross functionally on the implementation of business systems and tools and other continuous improvement projects.
* Conducts and leads project kick-off meetings to inform internal processing labs of project goals, scope, budget, and timelines.
* With support from the Senior Project Manager, perform data analysis and reporting for existing and future projects based on forecast information.
* Prepares for and hosts client visits
* Partner with direct manager, lab operations team, and quality to resolve observations and deviations based on results. Create, review, and edit SOPs as applicable.
* Develops schemas, workflows, and queries to compile, summarize, and analyze data for recurring technical reports. These should be consistent across all Commercial Project Management.
* Collaborate with direct manager to coordinate effective customer business review meetings with the Business Development and Comm Ops teams.
* Manage short and long-term customer project forecasts in collaboration with business development.
* Effectively facilitate a lessons learned event at the conclusion of projects to ensure capture of best practices, receive constructive feedback, and develop solutions and action plans to make the next project a success.
* With the support of the Senior Project Manager, translates protocol-level sample needs into clearly defined deliverables in support for each individual study or project.
* Develop and communicate status to PMO leadership.
* Monitor execution and quality to customer/stakeholder/sponsor standards.
* Provide strong team leadership and drive to ensure projects are executed on-time and within budget.
* Be effective team player, with behaviors reflecting the Sampled Values: Strive to delight our clients, Move innovation forward, Accelerate your business, Rise together as a team, Transcend what is possible.

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:*** Bachelor’s degree preferred, ideally in field of Life Sciences, Genetics, or Molecular Biology.
* 3 or more years of experience in a customer facing role.
* PMP, and/or comparable project management certifications highly desirable.
* Understanding of the sample logistic process and a strong ability to anticipate and navigate through challenges.
* Demonstrates knowledge of Project Management methods in order to support the business and customer needs.
* Demonstrates consistently good communication and interpersonal skills with colleagues, management and clients. Strong stakeholder management skills internally and externally, with ability to build relationships, resolve conflict, navigate through challenges and influence outcomes.
* Strong organization skills, with attention to priorities, effectively meeting deadlines and responding in a timely manner.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Thorough understanding of or the ability to quickly learn about the project or product being developed.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.

  

**Sampled is an Equal Opportunity Employer (M/F/Disabled/Veteran)**

title: Compounder
description:
**Accupac, Inc.**  

**Job Description**  

  

**Title: Compounder**  

**Hours: 3:00 PM-11:30 PM**  

**Basic Job Functions:*** The Compounder is responsible for manufacturing a customer’s product by following a set of written instructions. This activity involves the interpretation and execution of written instructions that results in a bulk product that conforms to the customer’s specifications. The Manufacturing operation is performed in a manner that complies with Accupac’s SOP and the FDA’s Good Manufacturing Practices Regulations.

**Essential Functions of the Job:*** Compounder level and compensation will be determined by successful completion and verification of levels in the Compounder Skill Level Chart.
* Clean and sanitize manufacturing related equipment and utensils.
* Set-up manufacturing equipment to support a specific manufacturing operation.
* Scan all labor activities into the central computer system.
* Document all relative activities associated to the batch in respective equipment logbooks.
* Verify that the manufacturing equipment is suitable for its intended use and that it has been cleaned & sanitized.
* Verify that the information on the raw material Barcode Tickets and the manufacturing batch card are in agreement and have not expired.
* Advise direct supervisor of any raw material information nonconformance and set the material aside for final disposition.
* Follow the customer’s written instructions. Advise the immediate supervisor of all process deviations.
* Advise the Quality Assurance Group when they can sample the completed bulk product.
* Prepare bulk storage tanks for new product receipts. Participate in the unloading process of the receipt.
* Perform the daily monitoring of manufacturing systems.
* Provide the Quality Assurance Laboratory with routine DI Water samples.
* Perform minor preventative maintenance tasks on the equipment.
* Perform the scheduled / routine cleaning and painting of the manufacturing area and equipment.
* Interface promptly and courteously with all Accupac, Inc. employees and visitors.
* Perform all jobs in a safe and efficient manner.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Requirements of the Job:*** Knowledge of written and spoken English sufficient for internal communication
* Ability to follow instructions.
* Ability to understand Standard Operating Procedures, cGMP's and communicate their requirements to others
* Ability to judge when equipment has been thoroughly cleaned and sanitized.
* Working knowledge of tools, hardware and basic machinery operation with ability to perceive different size and shape parts, and fit them together, correctly.
* Ability to work around solvents and chemicals needed for compounding tasks.
* Ability to work with hot water (+/- 180 degrees F) safely.
* Able to work different scheduled hours/shifts/days and overtime to meet the manufacturing schedule.

**Physical Requirements:*** Able to sustain a minimum of one (1) hour of strenuous activity.
* Able to lift 50 lbs. from the floor to waist level.
* Able to carry a container weighing up to 50 lbs. up a flight of stairs.
* Able to push or pull weights up to 50 pounds.
* Able to work in confined spaces.

* Able to work in a “dusty” environment.
* Able to work outside for up to 20% of the workday.
* Able to work with chemicals and solvents used for sanitizations. Must not be allergic to chemicals and solvents used for sanitizations

**Supervisory Responsibilities: No**

title: Manufacturing Sanitizer
description:
**Accupac, Inc.**  

**Job Description**  

  

**Title: Manufacturing Sanitizer I, II, and III**  

**Hours: Shift- 7:00AM-3:30PM**  

\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_  

  

**Basic Job Functions:**  

Responsible to clean and sanitize manufacturing tanks and auxiliary equipment to prevent product contamination during the manufacturing process following Standard Operating Procedures in compliance with cGMP's and safety regulations. To receive training and gain familiarity in the operation and composition of manufacturing equipment in order to qualify for advancement.  

  

**Essential Functions of the Job:*** Sanitizer level and compensation will be determined by successful completion and verification of levels in the Sanitizer Skill Level Chart.
* Perform Accupac’s “Super-clean/Super-sanitization” procedure on equipment as PM schedule requires.
* Dismantle and properly reassemble piping, valves, pumps, mills, tri-blenders, removing “O” rings from pumps.
* Clean and sanitize machinery inside and outside including piping, valves, pumps, mills and tri-blenders by applying hot water, Purified-water and alcohol with rags and brushes using pressure on the machinery to remove accumulated product and impurities.
* Inspect all disassembled parts, for wear and replace/order spare parts for inventory, as necessary.
* Clean up work area removing and storing cleaning utensils and solvents and disposing of soiled/used cleaners.
* Perform Preventive maintenance on equipment they have been trained on and properly document in all Log Books upon completion of tasks.
* Perform all jobs in a safe and efficient manner.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.

  

**Minimum Requirements of the Job:*** Knowledge of written and spoken English sufficient for internal communication
* Ability to follow instructions.
* Ability to understand Standard Operating Procedures, cGMP's and communicate their requirements to others
* Ability to judge when equipment has been thoroughly cleaned and sanitized.
* Working knowledge of tools, hardware and basic machinery operation with ability to perceive different size and shape parts, and fit them together, correctly.
* Ability to work around solvents and chemicals needed for sanitization tasks.
* Ability to work with hot water (+/- 180 degrees F) safely.

  

**Physical Requirements:*** Strength sufficient to lift up to 60 lbs
* The ability to push a 55 gallon drum full of bulk product up to six feet
* The ability to stand on concrete floors for full shift period
* The ability to hear speech and/or alarms through plant noise
* Peripheral vision
* Eyesight with or without corrective lenses to discern differences in small type characters for coder set ups
* The ability to recognize colors and shades of color
* The physical mobility to reach overhead and bend at and below waist level
* Manual dexterity to unfasten and fasten large and small parts using hand tools
* The ability to work with chemicals and solvents used for sanitizations. Must not be allergic to chemicals and solvents used for sanitizations
* The ability to work overtime as needed

  

**Supervisory Responsibilities:** No  

  

**Travel**: None  

  

**Education and/or Experience**: Must have a high school diploma or GED. Prefer previous experience working in a manufacturing environment and working with packaging equipment.

title: Server - Lounge/Cocktail
description:
*Perched sixty stories above Lower Manhattan, Manhatta serves seasonal, inspired cooking, and offers stunning views of New York City, its bridges, and waterways. Manhatta is a restaurant and full-service event space from Danny Meyer’s Union Square Hospitality Group, combining sky-high views with down-to-earth hospitality.*


**Who you are:**



Servers are responsible for ensuring that all guests who dine with us have memorable experiences filled with hospitality, delicious food and drinks, and exceptional service. The Server is the backbone of our Service team and is ultimately responsible for the sale and service of our food and beverages, while acting as a leader on the floor and providing our guests with warm and attentive hospitality.


**What you’ll do:**


* Demonstrate expertise of all food and beverage menu items with sound knowledge of all ingredients and preparations.
* Consistently follows steps of service with efficiency and grace, while maintaining a sense of urgency throughout service.
* Anticipates guest needs, ensuring constant communication with colleagues, management, and the kitchen at all times during service.
* Maintains the high standards of cleanliness and appearance throughout all areas of the restaurant both before, during and after service.
* Demonstrates an eagerness to continue to learn and grow.
* Consistently support a culture of Enlightened Hospitality.


**What we need from you:**


* 2+ years experience as a Server role in a full-service restaurant
* English fluency and additional languages preferred, but not required

**What you’ll get from us:**

* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance

* 51% dining discount throughout the USHG family of restaurants

title: Registered Nurse - Wound Care
description:
Restore First Health offers advanced care for chronic wounds, diabetes and metabolic disorders, non-invasive knee pain relief and physical therapy. We have multi-specialty practices in Georgia, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Kansas, Texas and Florida. Every member of our team plays an essential role to ensure we help make our patients better today and healthier tomorrow. Find your next career opportunity and make a difference doing what you love at Restore First Health.  

  

Restore First Health is seeking a dedicated and experienced Wound Care Specialist Registered Nurse to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for assessing, treating, and managing acute and chronic wounds in collaboration with our mobile wound care team. This position is scheduled to work Monday-Friday – Day Shift.  

  

Responsibilities:
* Conduct comprehensive wound assessments and develop individualized treatment plans.
* Provide evidence-based wound care interventions and treatments.
* Monitor wound healing progress and adjust treatment plans as necessary.
* Educate patients, caregivers, and healthcare staff on wound care best practices.
* Collaborate with physicians, therapists, and other healthcare professionals to ensure holistic patient care.
* Maintain accurate and updated patient records and documentation.
* Adhere to infection control protocols and best practices in wound care management.

Requirements:
* Active Registered Nurse (RN) State License in good standing.
* Wound Care Certification (WCC) preferred.
* Previous experience in wound care management is highly desirable.
* Strong clinical assessment and critical thinking skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.
* Compassionate and patient-centered approach to care.

  

This position is scheduled to work Monday-Friday – Day Shift  

  

At Restore First Health, we are committed to providing a positive work environment that supports the well-being of every team member and supports a work/life balance. We believe in taking care of our team members so our team members can focus on providing the best care possible for our patients and the communities we serve. We offer very competitive pay, paid holidays, two weeks of paid time off, sick leave, 401k matching, tuition reimbursement and multiple insurance plan options.

title: GME Coordinator - Medical Staff, OB/GYN
description:
**Overview:**  

St. Mary's General Hospital, located in Passaic, NJ, is a community-based tertiary medical center focused on providing quality, compassionate care. It is an acute care hospital providing a broad range of services including cardiovascular services as well as a comprehensive program for cancer care. The hospital is also a center of excellence for maternal-child health and outpatient behavioral health services. It is the only hospital in Passaic and with over 550 physicians and 1,000 employees, and is one of the largest employers in the county. Every member of the St. Mary's General team is committed to providing respectful, personalized, high-quality care. St. Mary's General Hospital is a member of Prime Healthcare, which has been lauded as a "Top 15 Healthcare System" by Truven Health Analytics. For information, visit www.smh-nj.com.
  
  

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status, disability, race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected characteristics. If you need special accommodation for the application process, please contact Human Resources. Know Your Rights: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC\\_KnowYourRights\\_screen\\_reader\\_10\\_20.pdf
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

With oversight and direction from the Program Director(s), the Program Coordinator is responsible for the operational functions of the accredited GME training programs. The position requires a comprehensive and detailed understanding of the national accreditation policies and hospital policies, as well as a high degree of initiative and independent judgment. The Program Coordinator should be organized in planning, assisting with maintaining continuing accreditation, recruiting of trainees, projects, analyzing and maintaining databases, communicating with faculty and trainees regarding a range of issues and managing internal and external program relations. Should have working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint and GME databases.

Education and Work Experience
  
  

1. Minimum of 3 – 5 years of Graduate Medical Education (GME) experience.
  
2. ACGME experience required.
  
3. TAGME certification preferred.
  
4. Experience with New Innovations
  
5. ERAS preferred.

title: Mental Health Patient Advocate
description:
A Mental Health Patient Advocate plays a crucial role in ensuring that individuals with mental health conditions receive the necessary support, resources, and treatment they need. This position requires a strong understanding of mental health issues, a compassionate demeanor, and excellent communication skills.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Advocacy:**


	+ Represent patients' interests and needs in healthcare settings, insurance companies, and community organizations.
	+ Educate patients and their families about their rights and options within the healthcare system.
	+ Assist patients in navigating complex healthcare systems, including insurance claims, referrals, and appointments.
* **Support:**


	+ Provide emotional support and guidance to patients and their families.
	+ Help patients develop coping strategies and manage stress.
	+ Connect patients with community resources, support groups, and other relevant services.
* **Case Management:**


	+ Coordinate patient care, including monitoring treatment plans, medication adherence, and appointments.
	+ Collaborate with healthcare providers, therapists, and social workers to ensure comprehensive care.
* **Education and Awareness:**


	+ Educate the community about mental health issues, stigma reduction, and available resources.
	+ Participate in outreach activities and public speaking engagements.
* **Documentation:**


	+ Maintain accurate and detailed records of patient interactions, interventions, and outcomes.
	+ Prepare reports and documentation as required.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in social work, psychology, counseling, or a related field.
* Experience working with individuals with mental health conditions.
* Strong understanding of mental health issues, treatment options, and the healthcare system.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Compassionate and empathetic demeanor.

**Additional Skills (Preferred):**

* Bilingual language skills.
* Experience with crisis intervention.
* Knowledge of insurance regulations and reimbursement procedures.

**Salary and Benefits:**


Salary and benefits will vary depending on the employer, location, and experience. Many organizations offer competitive compensation packages, including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.

title: Media Supervisor (Paid Social)
description:
**Company Description**  

We’re Razorfish. We’ve been leading the marketing industry with our digital expertise since the start of the internet. But in 2020, we did a full reboot. What’s different? It all starts with people. Weird, wonderful, complex people - with diverse backgrounds in strategy, creative and technology. But no matter how different we are, we all have one thing in common. We believe our differences are our strength. So we push for inclusion, challenge convention and bring in new perspectives, to inspire new ideas. Because when we connect by understanding what makes people different, we can create unforgettable experiences that enrich lives.

 **Job Description**  

The Paid Social Supervisor is a leadership position within the Paid Social department responsible for leading strategy and overseeing a team of Paid Social professionals. This individual acts as the strategic and operational point of contact and makes sure the team delivers flawlessly. This person also plays a key role in the professional development of the staff and continuously evolves processes.

**Core Skills**

* Collaborates with the internal teams on Paid Social media planning planning and measurement.
* Demonstrates a “big picture” understanding of clients’ Paid Social strategy.
* Consults on forecasting models.
* Is responsible for delivering ongoing timely thought capital.

**Client Exposure**

* Acts as the strategic client point of contact for Paid Social program management.
* Present regular strategy and campaign results to client POCs.
* Cultivate partner relationships in ways that are strategic and help drive client business.

**Business Development**

* Actively contributes to new business efforts by acting as a subject matter expert when needed.

**Team Leadership**

* Oversee a Media Planner on a large client team including: ongoing feedback on career development and participating in internal management training to develop leadership competency

**Agency Leadership**

* Develops thought capital and POV related to client work and the Paid Social landscape in general.
* Owns a Paid Social discipline development initiative (e.g. marketing, publisher relations committee, analytics, training program).
* Facilitates internal training programs on the Paid Social landscape and fosters best practice across clients.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 4+ years of Paid Social experience required.
* Hands-on-keyboard experience in all major Paid Social platforms including: campaign creation, audience segmentation/targeting, budget management and optimization is required.
* Conversant with all Paid Social terminology and key tools (e.g. Meta, TikTok, Reddit etc.).
* Demonstrated experience in a supervisory or mentorship role.
* Proficiency in MS Office with advanced Excel skills.
* Strong client-service orientation with keen sense for details.

  

**Additional Information**  

The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we must offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness benefit offerings include:

* Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
* Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
* Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
* Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance
* Tuition Assistance
* Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual sick days, Volunteer Days, Holiday, and identity days, and more
* Matching Gifts programs
* Flexible working arrangements
* ‘Work Your World’ Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for 6 weeks a year (based on eligibility)
* Business Resource Groups that support multipole affinities and alliances

*The benefits offerings listed are available to eligible U.S. based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents.*


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $70,000 - 110,000. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off.


The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will end 10/31/2024.

The key function of the Assistant Club Manager will be to help the Club Manager run the day to day operations of the club. The Assistant Club Manager will be an active participant of the team and will lead by example by providing a warm, engaging, up-beat and positive energy while serving all Members, Guests, and team mates throughout the entire club.


**Responsibilities:**



The Assistant Club Manager will support the Club Manager in the following:


* Drive sales through successful tour execution and lead generation activity
* Execute all initiatives that support the delivery of the Blink member experience
* Manage the staff on day to day performance
* Assist in driving Personal Training revenue

The Assistant Club Manager will be directly responsible for:


* Conduct weekly inventory, including retail, beverage, marketing collateral and maintenance supplies

Team Responsibilities:


* Facilitate new Member sign up and Guest trial transactions

Blink puts Mood Above Muscle™, which celebrates the positive feeling you get from exercise, not just the physical benefits.



For more information visit Blink’s consumer website - blinkfitness.com – and its franchise website – blinkfranchising.com.

title: Media Supervisor
description:
**Company Description**  

We’re Razorfish. We’ve been leading the marketing industry with our digital expertise since the start of the internet. But in 2020, we did a full reboot. What’s different? It all starts with people. Weird, wonderful, complex people - with diverse backgrounds in strategy, creative and technology. But no matter how different we are, we all have one thing in common. We believe our differences are our strength. So we push for inclusion, challenge convention and bring in new perspectives, to inspire new ideas. Because when we connect by understanding what makes people different, we can create unforgettable experiences that enrich lives.

 **Job Description**  

The Paid Social Supervisor is a leadership position within the Paid Social department responsible for leading strategy and overseeing a team of Paid Social professionals. This individual acts as the strategic and operational point of contact and makes sure the team delivers flawlessly. This person also plays a key role in the professional development of the staff and continuously evolves processes.

**Core Skills**

* Collaborates with the internal teams on Paid Social media planning planning and measurement.
* Demonstrates a “big picture” understanding of clients’ Paid Social strategy.
* Consults on forecasting models.
* Is responsible for delivering ongoing timely thought capital.

**Client Exposure**

* Acts as the strategic client point of contact for Paid Social program management.
* Present regular strategy and campaign results to client POCs.
* Cultivate partner relationships in ways that are strategic and help drive client business.

**Business Development**

* Actively contributes to new business efforts by acting as a subject matter expert when needed.

**Team Leadership**

* Oversee a Media Planner on a large client team including: ongoing feedback on career development and participating in internal management training to develop leadership competency

**Agency Leadership**

* Develops thought capital and POV related to client work and the Paid Social landscape in general.
* Owns a Paid Social discipline development initiative (e.g. marketing, publisher relations committee, analytics, training program).
* Facilitates internal training programs on the Paid Social landscape and fosters best practice across clients.

  

**Qualifications**  

* 4+ years of Paid Social experience required.
* Hands-on-keyboard experience in all major Paid Social platforms including: campaign creation, audience segmentation/targeting, budget management and optimization is required.
* Conversant with all Paid Social terminology and key tools (e.g. Meta, TikTok, Reddit etc.).
* Demonstrated experience in a supervisory or mentorship role.
* Proficiency in MS Office with advanced Excel skills.
* Strong client-service orientation with keen sense for details.

  

**Additional Information**  

The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we must offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness benefit offerings include:

* Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more
* Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility
* Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption
* Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance
* Tuition Assistance
* Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual sick days, Volunteer Days, Holiday, and identity days, and more
* Matching Gifts programs
* Flexible working arrangements
* ‘Work Your World’ Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for 6 weeks a year (based on eligibility)
* Business Resource Groups that support multipole affinities and alliances

*The benefits offerings listed are available to eligible U.S. based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents.*


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $70,000 - 110,000. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off.


The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will end 10/31/2024.

title: HR Manager
description:
Are you looking for a career that offers personal and professional growth, flexibility, and a supportive environment? Look no further! AG Care is an innovative organization committed to investing in our employees and providing the very best care to our patients.

At AG Care our mission is to serve our community with the highest compassionate and innovative care! We are committed to building a Team of dedicated, caring, and responsible professionals, who prioritize patients’ well-being and exceptional care services. Our HR Manager is a crucial part of our mission with their primary responsibilities to make decisions and address specific tasks in the best way possible, implement HR strategies, and facilitate the overall goals of the company.

**Responsibilities:**

* Oversee the entire recruitment process, from onboarding to offboarding.
* Implement and develop HR strategies aligned with the organization’s business objectives and values.
* Evaluate employee’s needs for training, professional development and educational needs.
* Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations.
* Conduct workplace investigations, disciplinary actions, and termination procedures with fairness and transparency.
* Develop, implement, and communicate HR policies and procedures.
* Manage employee relations by addressing concerns, grievances, and other sensitive issues in a professional and confidential manner.
* Collaborate with leadership to design and implement compensation, benefits, and performance management systems.
* Lead initiatives to enhance employee engagement, retention, and workplace culture.
* Provide HR guidance and support to management and staff on all human resource-related matters.
* Ensure HR systems and processes are optimized and scalable as the organization grows.
* Promote diversity, equity, and inclusion across the organization.
* Partner with external stakeholders, such as legal counsel, recruitment agencies, and employee benefits providers, as needed.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as an HR Manager (Healthcare Industry or related field is preferred).
* Strong Communication Skills.
* Excellent Leadership Skills.
* Strong Organizational Skills.
* Ability to adapt in a fast-paced and evolving environment, with a solution-oriented mindset.
* In-depth knowledge of employment laws, HR best practices, and regulatory requirements.
* A Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
* HR certification (e.g., PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP) is strongly preferred.

**Why pick AG Care for your next career move?**

We offer:

* Free Access to Company Services
* Growth and Advancement Opportunities
* Flexible Work Arrangements
* An Energetic and Growing Organization
* Development and Training
* Paid Time Off and Bonuses
* Education Discounts
* Excellent Leadership Who Will Place a Priority on Your Well-Being

* Paid time off

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Director of Early Childhood Education
description:
**Primary Role**

The Early Childhood Director is responsible for the overall management, supervision, and planning for the Early Childhood program. This is a full-time, advanced management position that requires independent judgment, initiative, creativity, and flexibility. The ECC Director shapes the curriculum, creates policies based on best practices, supervises the teaching and administrative staff, and oversees the daily operations of the center. They welcome collaboration with teaching staff and enjoy interacting with children. The ECC Director is passionate about building a dynamic center to serve families and their children. As families grow within the program, the ECC Director works to identify and build engagement opportunities for them throughout the agency.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Oversee the day-to-day operations of a year-round, developmentally appropriate, play-based program
* Implement a vision for excellence that includes best practices in early childhood education
* Foster a nurturing, inclusive, and engaging environment that reflects respect and compassion that is supportive of children, families, and teachers
* Develop and follow ECC budget and ensure the best business practices
* Plan, direct and supervise all Early Childhood Department Programs.
* Hire and lead a team of early childhood educators that promote each child’s cognitive, language, social-emotional, and motor skill development and who create an environment that fosters respect and builds community.
* Ensure compliance with all NYCDOH, Early Learn, PKA, ACS, and DOE standards, contracts, and reporting.
* Maintain regular, consistent, and meaningful communication with parents, staff, and colleagues.
* Work with managerial, administrative, and direct service staff to promote agency goals and standards that include involvement with agency-wide activities and interdepartmental projects.

**Qualifications and Skills**

* M.A. in Education or related field & a New York State Department of Education teacher certification in Early Childhood Education (B-2) or (N,K, Grades 1-6).
* Minimum of two years teaching experience in an Early Childhood Program and three years of supervisory experience in an educational setting.
* Complies with all Agency, State, City, and Federal regulations for a person working in an Early Childhood setting.
* Highly knowledgeable in working with Microsoft Office and NYC DOE computer systems.

**Agency Description**

The Hebrew Educational Society, a thriving multi-service, comprehensive community center located in southeast Brooklyn, provides a diverse array of programs and services within a multicultural, multi-ethnic environment that is inclusive of people of all ages and ability levels. Programs include Early Childhood, After School, Camps, Athletic and Aquatic Activities, Older Adults & People with disabilities.

Our Early Childhood Center currently offers full-day, year-round programming for children ages 3-5 including an NYC Early Learn program, Pre-K for All, extended day services, and Summer Camp. The Early Childhood Director provides overall program leadership and supervision, coordinates and implements an age and developmentally appropriate curriculum, engaging in program evaluation and planning as well as training and supervising teachers and support staff. A member of the HES Management Team, the Early Childhood Director reports to the Agency’s Associate Executive Director.

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year
