title: Mandarin Teacher for Kids (Brooklyn, NY, in-person)
description:
As a Mandarin Teacher, you will help to create a well-structured, inclusive, and fun language learning environment for our young learners in grades 1 to 2. You will use your experience, creativity, and passion for languages to create a place that is warm, positive, and organized, yet challenging and able to hold students accountable for their growth. Your teaching will be consistent with our mission, vision, and methodology. **This role starts immediately.**

Job Responsibilities:

* Teach 3 hours of classes weekly, each lasting an hour.
* **Must be available to start in September, Wednesdays-Fridays, 3-4 pm.**
* **Must be available to work in Brooklyn, NY.**
* A demo is needed during the interview.
* Work closely with our Founder and other teachers to continuously improve relevant curricula
* Use assessment data, student work, and other information to inform plans for student and class objectives
* Use positive reinforcement and social learning strategies as your way of teaching
* Prioritize each student's academic and social environment
* Understand and work in accordance with our mission and vision

About You:

* Bachelor's degree required; master's degree in education strongly preferred
* Native-like level of proficiency in Mandarin
* A deep understanding of Chinese culture
* A deep belief in our mission and vision with a strong enthusiasm, passion, and energy
* A deep belief in community building and bonding to achieve results
* Authorized to work in the U.S.
* Preference will be given to teachers who have undergone fingerprinting for the DOE
* The critical features of this role are described above but are not all encompassing

Our Goal:

We empower people to immerse themselves in new cultures and create meaningful connections through language learning. We believe that language learning leads to cross-cultural understanding, so we aim to make it more accessible and more impactful than ever. Our goal is to help students achieve language mastery through methods focused on social learning. We rely on data to inform progress and our decision-making process, all while engaging in culturally-responsive pedagogy. As a teacher, your job is as much to teach about the language as it is to teach its cultural context and help to continue to build a culturally competent and understanding society.

About Us:

Diáfano is the language learning hub of the future, with human-centered philosophy at its very core. The Diáfano Method fuses tried and true methods of language learning with our own modern spin. Designed by a linguist and administered by a global community of top-tier native educators, our method hacks into the psychology of language learning to ensure maximum retention and true mastery.

Our Core Values:

* Mastery: We strive for mastery in everything that we do.
* Sincerity: Integrity means a lot to us. It is at the core of who we are.
* Innovation: We create our own rules to give you an experience and results you won’t find anywhere else.
* Inclusivity: We are driven to create classes that are culturally-relevant and driven. We believe in inclusivity from the teachers we hire to the courses we teach.
* Connection: We care about people, first and foremost. We always create a nurturing environment that supports bonding, connection, and growth.

Pay is competitive and negotiable.

We regret not being able to respond to all inquiries. No phone calls please.

To apply, please submit your resume to Irma Cedeno Verdon, irma@diafanomethod.com

Pay: $45.00 - $50.00 per hour

* Are you authorized to work in the US?
* Have you undergone fingerprinting for the DOE?
* Do you have experience teaching children in grades 1 - 2?

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Counselors work a compressed work week of schedule of 10AM-8PM Monday through Thursday during the school year and 9AM-7PM during the summer, with Fridays always off.

Clinical Supervision for clinical licensure is available for Masters-level candidates. Internship supervision is available for work-study MSW and counseling students.

ARK Pet Oasis specifically addresses all of the travel needs of domestic pets including short-term respite care, pick-up and delivery from and to cargo or passenger terminals, veterinary exams and certification for domestic pets travelling by air to, from and through JFK, LGA and EWR as well as dogs employed at the airport by various law enforcement agencies.

title: Associate Research Scientist
description:
The Division of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry is looking for a full time Associate Research Scientist to work within the Translational Research on Affective Disorders and Suicide Laboratory at Columbia University (auerbachlab.com), directed by Dr. Randy P. Auerbach. The Associate Research Assistant will support NIH/NIMH- and foundation-funded projects that aim to identify neural (structural and functional MRI) and real-time (e.g., experience sampling, passive sensor) markers of depression and suicide in adolescents. The Associate Research Scientist will have opportunities to pursue independent research, grants (e.g., R-awards), and interdisciplinary collaborations across Columbia University.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Provide training and supervision to undergraduate, post-baccalaureate, masters, and doctoral level trainees regarding neural bases of depression and suicide.
* Manage study protocols and IRB-related tasks, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
* Support federal grant requirements through data-related tasks such as progress reports, study ramp-up activities, and study close-out tasks.
* Develop and manage study-related and lab-related RedCap surveys.
* Provide support to study PI to develop and maintain Human Research Protection Program compliant documentation, training, and research.
* Conduct initial data quality assurance checks and collaborate with internal and external data teams to ensure accurate and complete data collection.
* Other related responsibilities that emerge in order to complete the lab’s work (e.g., data analysis, processing).

**Qualifications**

**MINIMUM DEGREE REQUIRED:**

Applicants must have a PhD or MD in psychology, psychiatry, or related field.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Applicants should have a PhD or MD with a strong track record in clinical, affective, and translational neuroscience.
* The ideal candidate will have more 3 years of electrophysiology experience, particularly as it relates to a track record of developing automated processing pipelines for EEG, ERPs, and oscillations.
* Experience with matlab, EEGLab, and ERPLab is required.
* Candidates also must have a track record of extramural funding and a strong publication history.

**Application Process**This institution is using Interfolio's Faculty Search to conduct this search. Applicants to this position receive a free Dossier account and can send all application materials, including confidential letters of recommendation, free of charge.Apply Now**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**

Columbia University is an Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

**Pay Transparency Disclosure**

The salary of the finalist selected for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to departmental budgets, qualifications, experience, education, licenses, specialty, and training. The above hiring range represents the University’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting.

title: Field Representative - Part Time
description:
**Are you looking for a part-time job that allows you the flexibility to set a schedule that works with your busy life and has unlimited earnings potential? Then join RetailData's growing and diverse Field Representative Team!**

We are seeking individuals to join our team who are self-motivated, detail oriented and most importantly dependable. We have been the leading provider of retail intelligence to the largest retailers in the world for over 30 years and have growing demands for additional Field Representatives to help us to collect critical retail information such as pricing, promotion, and merchandising data.
 

**What will you be doing?**

* On the agreed schedule that you set in partnership with your manager, you will be asked use our company app to record prescribed product information.
* There will be specific criteria that you will be asked to follow to capture information such as item prices, displayed promotions and potentially pictures of product merchandising and/or displays.
* Once you have successfully met the criteria of the project you simply transmit the file electronically to our corporate office for review and packaging to our clients.

**What does RetailData Offer You** ?


* A comprehensive initial training program to ensure you fully understand the expectations of the position.
* Competitive productivity-based compensation that has a guaranteed minimum with unlimited upside as you increase your aptitude and proficiency in completing projects for the company.
* As a part-time team member, you are offered identity theft protection, pet insurance, and 401k with match after 6 months and 750 hours worked.
* Employee stock purchase after 1 year of service.
* Optimized, flexible work schedules that enable a healthy work-life balance.
* Paid drive time and mileage reimbursement.
Opportunities for employee learning and development.  
*

* At least 18 years of age.

* Valid driver's license, clean driving record, reliable transportation, and valid automobile insurance.

description:
Base Salary + Sign On Bonus (SOB)

AdvantageCare Physicians (ACPNY) is a primary and specialty care practice serving half a million patients across the New York metropolitan area. With more than 35 medical offices across New York City and Long Island, ACPNY is continually expanding our practice and enhancing our services for communities throughout New York. As we grow, our employees grow with us.

**The ideal candidate should have**

· Work experience as a Nurse in a hospital or ambulatory setting

· Patient-centered approach toward a positive patient experience

· Excellent communication skills

· Interest in Population Health

**Responsibilities**

Our Registered Nurses organizes and provides clinical supervision to the patient care team including, but not limited to, delegation of responsibilities, mentoring, evaluating, educating, scheduling and counseling the care team staff. Our Registered Nurses are responsible for providing professional nursing care to patients and proactively supports the efforts to ensure that standards for patient satisfaction, patient safety, and quality of care are maintained, as established by AdvantageCare Physicians. This role functions as one of the primary liaisons between patients, staff and physicians and supports the Advanced Care Model.

**Qualifications**

* Graduate of an accredited school of nursing
* Current, unrestricted, licensure in the State of New York as a Registered Nurse
* Knowledge of professional nursing theory, regulations and practices to give and evaluate patient care
* Knowledge or Electronic Medical Records (EMR)
* Ability to work independently within scope of practice, make appropriate clinical decisions and delegate appropriately
* Basic Life Support (BLS) required

**Medical Office Hours of Operation**

· Monday-Thursday 8:00AM – 6:00PM

· Friday 8:00AM – 5:00PM

**Why work at AdvantageCare Physicians?**

ACPNY’s vision is to become a home for health that provides personal, effective, and convenient care for the neighborhoods and communities we serve. When our teams of providers, nurses, and specialists work together, we can get patients in sooner, answer their questions in real time, and give them the support they need to achieve their health goals. Everything we do is guided by our values:

Empower — We believe in acting as proactive self-starters and enabling our colleagues to succeed.

Deliver — We believe in achieving our goals and taking accountability for our actions.

Do It Together — We believe in caring for our customers, patients, and one another, while valuing diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Encouraging growth and development is an important part of the employee experience at ACPNY. We empower employees to develop both personally and professionally through a variety of programs, including internal collaborative learning opportunities where team members share stories from their own lives, discuss research, and ultimately learn from each other.

We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to creating a strong workplace and community.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
**Position Overview**

Solar Art is an installer of window film for residential and commercial buildings. The Warehouse Associate keeps the office moving by maintaining the film inventory, running an efficient and safe warehouse, maintaining company vehicles, and supporting the office team. The role requires a high level of organizational skill, a desire to understand our products, and a passion for supporting a talented team to get their work done efficiently. It will suit someone who can balance competing priorities and is passionate about getting the job done effectively while contributing to a positive team environment.

**Key Job Responsibilities**

Warehouse & Inventory Management

* Keep the warehouse organized and safe
* Manage the film inventory, ensuring film is ready on time each day for the installers to collect and accurately checked back in upon return
* Using online tools to look ahead at upcoming jobs, including CRM and in-house software, stay ahead of inventory needs by ordering and tracking product. Help update job information throughout the lifecycle of the project
* Keep track of inbound and outbound shipments, following up with delivery providers where necessary
* Learn about window film, to understand when it’s acceptable to suggest a substitute
* Perform calculations based on information provided in work orders to determine how much film each job requires
* Conduct accurate and timely inventory audits

Vehicles

* Maintain records of company vehicles, regularly conducting cleanliness and mileage checks
* Ensure regular maintenance is conducted on every vehicle, collecting and dropping off vehicles as needed
* Oversee repairs of vehicles, substituting with rentals where needed

Office Support

* Support the estimators by maintaining an adequate stock of film samples and professionally packaging up samples to mail to customers
* Maintain and order supplies and tools to ensure the installation team and the office is properly equipped and stocked

Teamwork

* Be flexible and seek out opportunities to help other office team members experiencing high-volumes of work
* Answer the phones during busy times and provide excellent customer service

**Job Requirements**

* Responsive and friendly customer service
* Effective organization of multiple concurrent jobs
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Familiarity working with online tools like g-suite
* Knowledge of window film is a plus but training will be provided
* CRM experience is a plus
* Sales experience is a plus

**Competencies**

* Planning and Organizing
* Customer Service
* Attention to Detail
* Follow Through

title: Records Retention Manager
description:
Key responsibilities include managing records processing, storage, and disposition, overseeing operating systems and vendor relationships, and ensuring the security of member data. Manager develops and sustains the new pledged collateral process and collaborates with the Secondary Market Team and S3 Service Center to implement an Investor Paid In Full process.


**Bethpage has a commitment to excellence and the highest standards of member service. Our values and behaviors are critical to the success and growth of the business and they were all created with a unique cultural foundation. To review our values and behaviors, please visit** **The Brand is You****.**



The estimated salary range for this role $80,089.00 to $96,107.00 annually.



**Responsibilities Include:** (Please summarize the 4-8 main responsibilities/accountabilities of the position. List responsibilities in the order of importance and time spent.)

  

* 
Implements policies and develops procedures for the retention of physical and electronic records in compliance with legal and regulatory requirements. Monitors and maintains the records management program’s policies and procedures.

  

* 
Oversees operation and maintenance of records management practices, including creation, receipt, storage, retrieval, and disposition of records. Maintains records according to the appropriate records retention guidelines and procedures to ensure compliance with applicable policies, regulations, and statutes. Ensures proper and timely disposition of records in accordance with record retention schedules. Coordinates with other departments and business partners to streamline record-keeping processes and facilitate easy access to information or physical documents when needed.

  

* 
Establishes and oversees Bethpage’s pledged process for collateralized documents.



Responsible for quality control check of loan records against 3rd party lender requirements, checks loan collateral to ensure all of the required documentation (originations, trailing documents) has been provided, prepares data files to the custodian, and works with the team in the preparation and shipment of collateral to the custodian as per their written instructions. Addresses any collateral discrepancies & collaborates with S3 service center to make corrections to documents and send updated versions to the custodian in a timely manner.

  

* 
Creates and maintains mortgage release process. Develops and manages the documentation, tracking, and storage processes for paid-in-full collateral. Ensure all paid-in-full (PIF) collateral complies with minimum retention requirements and oversee the disposition of these records.

  

* 
Develops and manages annual budget.

  

* 
Provides guidance and training to staff in the development and integration of records management methods and procedures into daily activities. Establishes departmental standards and service levels objectives.

  

* 
Manages third party service provider relationships to ensure contractual obligations are met

  

* 
Conduct regular audits to ensure accuracy and completeness of physical records inventory. Maintains effective communications with other departments to ensure business needs are being met

  

* 
Actively contributes to ongoing process improvement and efficiency efforts. Provide ad hoc project support of related projects

  


  

* Certified Records Manager (CRM) preferred
* Familiarity with loan collateral and the various types of documents typically executed during the closing process.
* Requires the ability to exert light physical effort in sedentary to light work. Some lifting, carrying, pushing and/or pulling of objects and materials of light weight (40-50 pounds).
* Ability to perform value look-ups and manage data across multiple files using formulas.
* Tasks may involve extended periods of time at keyboard or workstation.

#### **Experience**


Required* 3 - 5 years: 3-5 years experience in record retention leadership

#### **Education**


Required* Bachelors or better

#### **Skills**


Required* Supervisory
* MS Excel
* Detail Oriented

#### **Behaviors**


Required* Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking

#### **Motivations**


Required* Goal Completion: Inspired to perform well by the completion of tasks

title: Workday Integrations Analyst II
description:
Join the Innovation at Shutterstock: Workday Integrations Analyst
Are you ready to be part of a global, creative powerhouse that connects artists, brands, and professionals? Shutterstock is more than just a platform; it's where creators are inspired to discover new ways to deliver their best work. We're a company built on growth, creativity, and innovation—and we're looking for passionate individuals like you to help drive us forward!
Why Shutterstock?* Make an Impact: Your work will directly contribute to our company's success, driving meaningful change and innovation in our core business.
* Growth-Oriented Leadership: Our leadership team is dedicated to your personal and professional development. We prioritize your career growth and align your journey with your passions.
* Flexibility: Options to work from either home or in office with the tools and support needed to excel in both environments.
* Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy a generous benefits package designed to support your overall well-being.


The Opportunity: Workday Integrations Analyst
In this critical role, you will provide technical support for Workday integrations across our Financial, Human Resources, and Payroll systems. Collaborating with functional and technical teams, you'll troubleshoot, test, and optimize existing and new integrations to ensure seamless operations. Your expertise will help maintain the quality and consistency of our HR and financial data, with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.
What You’ll Be Doing:* Monitoring and troubleshooting all system integrations, detecting and resolving technical issues
* Supporting semi-annual regression testing and collaboration with various teams to enhance integration architecture
* Designing, building, and implementing Workday Studio integrations, XML transformations, and other integration methods
* Preparing documentation to ensure quality and consistency in integration processes
* Partnering cross-functionally with IT, Finance, and HR to develop and implement integration enhancements


What We’re Looking For:* Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields
* 5+ years of experience in a fast-paced environment, with at least 2 years supporting Workday integrations
* Expertise in Workday Studio development, XSLT, BIRT, Core Connectors, Document Transformation, and more
* Analytical thinker with a proven ability to troubleshoot complex issues and think outside the box
* Self-starter with excellent communication skills, capable of thriving in both independent and collaborative settings


The pay range for this position is below:* 80,000 - 90,000 per year in New York


Be Part of Our Inclusive Culture
At Shutterstock, we celebrate diversity and individuality. We believe that a wide range of perspectives and backgrounds drives creativity and success. We’re committed to creating a culture where everyone feels they belong and can thrive.
Ready to bring your unique talents to our global team? Apply today and help us shape the future at Shutterstock!

We are one team collectively focused on creating an unrivaled experience for our Customers and Contributors. Our Values represent the mindset of the employee who will thrive at Shutterstock. title: Group Facilitator
description:
**Job Title:** Experienced Group Facilitator – Outpatient Substance Abuse Treatment Facility (Part-Time, Morning IOP/PC Groups)

**Location:** Perth Amboy

**Job Type:** Part-Time (Morning Hours)

**Overview:** We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Group Facilitator to run Intensive Outpatient Program (IOP) and Partial Care (PC) groups at our substance abuse treatment facility. The ideal candidate will have a passion for helping individuals overcome addiction and demonstrate expertise in facilitating engaging and therapeutic group sessions. This is a part-time morning position designed to support clients in their recovery journey through IOP and PC groups.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Facilitate morning IOP and PC group therapy sessions focused on substance use disorder, recovery, and mental health.
* Develop and implement engaging group curricula tailored to the needs of clients at various stages of recovery in both IOP and PC programs.
* Encourage open and respectful communication, providing a safe and supportive space for participants.
* Use evidence-based therapeutic techniques such as Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), and Motivational Interviewing.
* Assess group dynamics and adjust facilitation style to maintain a productive and healing atmosphere.
* Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, including counselors, case managers, and medical staff, to provide comprehensive care.
* Document group sessions accurately, including client participation, progress, and relevant clinical observations.
* Continuously evaluate group effectiveness and make necessary adjustments to meet the evolving needs of clients.
* Uphold the facility’s policies and ethical standards, maintaining confidentiality and professionalism at all times.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Psychology, Social Work, Counseling, or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience facilitating groups in a substance abuse treatment or mental health setting.
* CADC, LCADC, LPC, LCSW or equivalent certification required.
* Strong knowledge of addiction recovery principles, including 12-step programs and alternative therapeutic models.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and group management skills.
* Ability to engage and motivate clients from diverse backgrounds with different levels of readiness for change.
* Flexibility and adaptability in managing group dynamics and addressing individual client needs.
* Proficiency in maintaining accurate documentation and case notes in compliance with HIPAA.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience with co-occurring mental health disorders.
* Familiarity with trauma-informed care.
* Knowledge of Zoobook EHR or similar electronic health record systems.

**Schedule:**

* Part-time position, morning hours for IOP and PC groups.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience.
* Opportunities for professional development and continuing education.

Job Type: Part-time

Expected hours: 20 per week

Application Question(s):

* Do you have knowledge of addiction recovery principles including 12-step programs and alternative therapeutic models?

Experience:

* substance abuse / mental health setting: 3 years (Required)
* EHR systems: 1 year (Preferred)
* facilitating groups in a mental health setting: 3 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* CADC, LCADC, LPC, LCSW or any equivalent certification (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Perth Amboy, NJ 08861 (Preferred)

title: Workday Finance Analyst I
description:
Join Our Team as a Workday Finance Analyst at Shutterstock!
About Us:
Shutterstock is a leading tech company headquartered in New York City, driving creativity and innovation worldwide. As a growing and profitable organization, we empower visual content creators through cutting-edge technology and a global platform. Now, we're looking for a dynamic and results-oriented Workday Finance Analyst to join our team and support our continued success.
The Role:
As a Workday Finance Analyst, you'll have the chance to make a significant impact by working closely with teams across our Finance organization. You'll be the go-to expert on Workday Finance, helping us streamline processes, enhance automation, and ensure operational efficiency.

title: Power Plant Operations Manager
description:
WIN Waste Innovations is currently looking for a dynamic Operations Manager who has the ability to manage all activities related to operations and development of the facility. Responsible for the safe, proper, and efficient operation and maintenance of the facility in accordance with company policies and standards, under the direction of the Plant Manager. Manage and coordinate Maintenance activities to include but not be limited to installing, inspecting, testing, repairing, adjusting, and calibrating all plant equipment and instrumentation. Plan and conduct major outages; implement and direct effective PM program, lubrication plans.

**Education and Experience**

* Three years or more previous experience in comparable role in an administrative support or business support role is required.
* Bachelor's or Associates degree in a technical field or equivalent desirable
* Six years' experience in an incineration plant environment, with a minimum of five years in a supervisory role.
* For all Massachusetts facility's, a 2nd Class Engineers license is required and the applicant must be able to demonstrate the skills, experience and knowledge to sit for a 1st Class Engineers license.

**Work Environment:** 

Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

* Noise in work environment

**Physical Demand:**

* Stand
* Sit for prolonged periods of time
* Walk
* Handle tools, equipment, fine motor skills
* Reach with hands and arms
* Climb and walk on heights often greater than 4 feet
* Stoop, kneel, bend, push, pull, crawl
* Ascend and descend stairs and stationary vertical ladders as part of normal work activity and emergency egress situations
* Lift 50 lbs.
* Move about all areas of the plant, including catwalks, deck grating, and uneven surfaces
* Close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, corrected or otherwise
* Operate a 1.5-inch fire hose operating at 125 psi line pressure to the extent required to extinguish fire
* Operate fire extinguishing equipment ranging from handheld extinguishers to 200 lb portable units
* Access confined spaces and pressure vessels through standard 12" by 16" manways

**PPE Required:**

Work in areas under adverse conditions that may require the donning and use of personal protective equipment including, but not limited to, the following with average fatigue:

* Negative pressure respirator
* Positive pressure respirator
* Self-contained breathing apparatus (steel or composite bottle)
* Hardhat
* Approved safety shoes
* Eye protection
* Rubber suit and gloves
* Chemical resistant suit
* Heat resistant outerwear
* Flame resistant outerwear
* Approved hearing protection
* Gloves
* Safety harness

At WIN Waste Innovations, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as Company match on 401K, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site. title: Echo Tech
description:
Join our dynamic team as an **Echo Tech/ Medical Assistant** with a Cardiac background, where your expertise will play a crucial role in patient care.

Apply now to be part of our committed team.

**Who we are**

We are a medical testing facility that specializes in comprehensive cardiovascular and pulmonary medical evaluations for first responders throughout New Jersey. Our practice was built out of the Captain Buscio Program, a foundation created by Donna Buscio after her husband, Captain Dominick Buscio of the Jersey City Fire Department, unexpectedly passed away at 39 from a heart attack.  
Our cardiovascular and pulmonary tests help current and retired members of the police force, state troopers, firefighters, and EMTs to be aware of their cardiovascular health and help to identify any health concerns. Employers do not mandate our tests and the results do not affect our patients' employment. Currently, We have six different locations across New Jersey and hope to open more soon.

**What we do**

We administer tests to evaluate heart and lung functionality. We offer seven different tests for our patients over a five-hour appointment time slot. Our patients can come back two weeks after their appointment to review their results with our board-certified medical professionals.

**What we are looking for**

You will be responsible for providing administrative support to ensure the efficient operation of the medical office/hospital. You will support doctors and patients through various tasks related to patient care management, organization, and communication. As an employee will have access to **medical, vision, and dental insurance as well as PTO.**

**Responsibilities:**

· Collect patient vitals and medical history.

· Update medical records in the electronic medical records.

· Communicating with patients

· Arrange hospital admissions and laboratory services.

· Submitting patient tests to labs to be professionally reviewed.

· Assist during medical examinations.

· Handle receivable and payable accounts and keep financial records.

· Ensure that the medical facilities are sanitized before and after every patient.

· Administer cardio-pulmonary tests on patients.

· Setting up and maintaining ultrasound equipment

· Performing ultrasound examinations on patients

· Producing images resulting from the ultrasound examinations

· Interpreting ultrasound images to aid patient diagnosis

· Additional clinical duties as needed.

**Required**:

· Medical Assistant Degree

· Registered Sonography license

· ARDMS Certification

· Certified Clinical Medical Assistant (CCMA) (Preferred)

· Microsoft and Google Office Suite: 1 year (Preferred)

· EMR systems: 2 years (Preferred)

· Phlebotomy: 1 year (Preferred)

· Medical Terminology: 1 year (Preferred)

· Spanish Speaking is a plus

· Medical records experience plus

description:
### **Overview**


Enterprise Mobility operates the Enterprise Rent-A-Car, National Car Rental, and Alamo car rental brands and has frequently been named one of the top places to work. Enterprise Mobility is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in North America and we are hiring now! We are working towards our shared vision to be the world's best and most trusted mobility company.  

The Enterprise brand of Enterprise Mobility has an exciting opportunity for an Administrative Representative. The Administrative Representative will provide a high level of customer service by assisting both internal and external customers primarily via the phone, in addition to administrative support. **This position is for our JFK Airport office located at 308 Federal Circle, Jamaica, NY 11430**
The starting rate of pay is $18.25 / hour. Employees have the opportunity to earn yearly merit increases based on performance.  

We offer:* Paid time off
* Consistent full time 40 hour per week schedule
* Employee discount
* Retirement savings plan including 401k with matching profit sharing
* Health Insurance
* Life Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Training and development

  

Schedule Available:*\\*1 hour break daily\\**
Sunday 12p-9p
Monday OFF
Tuesday OFF
Wednesday 12p-9p
Thursday 12p-9p
Friday 12p-9p
Saturday 12p-9p### **Responsibilities**


We are hiring now for immediate openings. Responsibilities include:* Take incoming calls- reservations, rate quotes, general questions and answers, provide information and resolution for customers, other branches, insurance companies, dealerships, repair shops and other vendors
* Make outgoing calls- callback management, A/Rs and miscellaneous calls as assigned
* Provide a high level of customer service by assisting customers and assessing their rental needs primarily over the phone
* Meet and greet customers in a friendly and timely manner
* Provide directions and general assistance
* Assist to assess condition of rental upon return
* Process returns, check-ins and exit kiosk transactions
* May assist with or perform customer pick-ups in a safe and courteous manner
* Notify Management of any known customer problems
* Notify Management of any known vehicle problems and any required vehicle maintenance
* Clean vehicle interior and exterior by hand or by operating washing equipment when needed
* Perform various administrative and basic accounting functions such as: research and billing support tasks, accounts receivables, transfer and key logs, run miscellaneous reports, supply maintenance, process customer billing
* Perform miscellaneous and backup job-related duties as assigned

 *Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans*### **Qualifications**

* Must be at least 18 years of age
* High School Diploma or G.E.D. required
* Must have a minimum of 1 year prior customer service retail or administrative support experience
* Must be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future
* The ability to operate a motor vehicle is an essential function of this position. Applicants must have a valid, unrestricted driver's license
company_description: We are paving a new way forward by creating better experiences for how we move.

title: House Manager
company: The Archdiocese of New York - Central Services
description:
**Overview/Purpose:**

This position is a part-time, non-exempt, and on-call guest services supervisory position within the Sheen Center front-of-house operations area. This person is intended to provide part-time support to Sheen Center operations on a per-event basis. The House Manager has a higher leadership role among the part-time House staff, as they will serve as the ranking authority in the event the Patron Services Manager is not present for a particular event or daily shift. Incumbent will supervise or assist in daily and event supervision of the front desk, box office, seating, concessions, receptions and studio activities. A key focus of this hybrid position is to help shape an exceptional guest experience for patrons following established Sheen Center guidelines.

**Work Location:** 18 Bleecker Street, New York, NY 10012

**Reports to:** Patron Services Manager

**Responsibilities:**

* List the responsibilities of the job in a bulleted list
* Provide a breakdown of the core aspects of the job and those functions for daily tasks and long term tasks
* Include the essential functions of the position and the duties that are expected to be performed
* List the standards that are expected to be followed to ensure that this position is maintaining the day to day & long term operations of the office/department
* Supervise and/or assist in the supervision of house staff daily as needed and during events.
* Act as fireguard during performances and events, maintaining a safe environment for all patrons and rental clients.
* Provide exceptional customer service to all patrons/clients and to resolve any event related issues quickly and respectfully.
* Oversee box office, front desk and concessions cash box distribution and collection.
* Ensure daily cash count is accurate and all currency us secured in the safe.
* Monitor concessions/merchandise inventory and inform Patron Services Manager when stock needs to be replenished.
* Complete detailed reports at the conclusion of an event/performance to be reviewed.

**Education, Experience, and Skills:**

* A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field is preferred, but not required.
* Equivalent supervisory work experience with an arts venue or experience working in the customer/guest services industry.
* Proficiency with MS Office products required.
* Familiarity with industry standards for all house staff roles Experience with Point of Sale and AudienceView ticketing software systems preferred.
* Must have supervisory experience and the ability to multi-task.
* Exemplary interpersonal communication, phone, and guest services skills.
* Positive professional attitude and appearance.
* Ability to work independently as well collaboratively as part of a team.
* Strong alignment with Sheen Center mission and goals.
* Valid NYC Fire Guard (F-03) status or must be obtained and be familiar with Sheen Center venue capacity limits.
* Familiar with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) laws and regulations as they pertain to performance venues.
* Valid AED/CPR certification or must be obtained within thirty days of employment.
* Valid ServSafe Food Manager and TIPS Alcohol Certification desired.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with flexible hours and availability to work required nights and weekends. Assignments may include light lifting up to twenty five pounds and standing for long periods.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: No more than 29 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible spending account
* Paid time off
* Parental leave

Schedule:

* Holidays
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10012 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Medical Assistant
description:
**Medical Assistant**

is a leading fertility clinic network and family-building benefits provider for employers offering comprehensive virtual and in-person care. Kindbody's clinically managed program includes fertility assessments and education, fertility preservation, genetic testing, in vitro fertilization (IVF), donor and surrogacy services, and adoption, as well as physical, mental, and emotional support from preconception through postpartum. Kindbody is the trusted fertility benefits provider for more than 110 employers, covering more than 2.4 million lives. Many thousands more receive their fertility care directly from Kindbody throughout the country at signature clinics, mobile clinics, and partner clinics. As the fertility benefits provider, technology platform, and direct provider of high-quality care, Kindbody delivers a seamless, integrated experience with superior health outcomes at lower cost, making fertility care more affordable and accessible for all.

**About the Role**

As an experienced Medical Assistant, you will be working in a fast-paced, rapidly growing environment where you will be relied on for your expertise, professionalism and collaboration. The hours will be determined based on availability and need, with occasional weekend and holiday shifts.

**Responsibilities**

* High volume of phlebotomy
* Maintain and inventory supplies for the clinical operations
* Ensure lab specimens are ordered, collected, and sent to proper labs
* Document patient care services utilizing daily logs and patient records
* Utilizing Kindbody's proprietary EMR system and online laboratory portals to place lab orders and print patient labels
* Assist provider or ultrasound technician with various fertility and GYN procedures
* Prepare and maintain a safe surgical environment
* Sterilization of medical instruments using an autoclave
* Take vital signs and provide general clinical assistance
* Assists with the clinical care of fertility patients
* Provides patient/couple counseling, procedure teaching, communicates physician orders and instructions
* Provides pre and post op education
* Establishes a compassionate environment by providing emotional and psychological support to patients and patients’ families
* Ensure the patient environment is set up, organized and clean
* Works independently to assure the program goals are achieved
* Willing to train new team members
* Support and promote excellence in customer service
* Provide feedback to HQ on process improvement and job specifications to help gain efficiencies in your day to day

**Who You Are** 

* Completion of a formal MA program
* Strong phlebotomy skills
* Ability to give intramuscular injections
* Minimum 2 years of experience in GYN, fertility is a plus
* Minimum 1 year experience in GYN procedures
* Minimum 2 years experience working in an EMR
* Minimum 1-2 years experience in supply ordering and inventory
* Knowledge of Medical Instruments and Sterilization
* Strong communication skills & a team player
* Willingness to be flexible and cross train in other roles when necessary
* Detail oriented
* Exemplifies strong customer service skills and professionalism
* Open to work weekends and holidays as needed

**Perks and Benefits**

Kindbody values our employees and wants to do everything to ensure that our employees are happy and professionally fulfilled, but also that they have the opportunity to be healthy. We are committed to providing a number of affordable and valuable health and wellness benefits to our employees, such as paid vacation and sick time; paid time off to vote; medical, dental and vision insurance; FSA + HSA options; Company-paid life insurance; Short Term + Long Term Disability options; Paid Parental Leave (up to 12 weeks fully paid dependent on years of service); 401k plans, monthly guided meditation and two free cycles of IVF/IUI or egg freezing and free egg storage for as long as you are employed.

Additional benefits, such as paid holidays, commuter transit benefits, job training & development opportunities, social events and wellness programming are also available. We are constantly reevaluating our benefits to ensure they meet the needs of our employees.

In an effort to protect our employees and our patients, Kindbody strongly encourages all employees to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. However, some states are requiring that all healthcare workers be fully vaccinated. Candidates seeking employment at Kindbody in the following states will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof of your COVID-19 vaccine prior to your start date of employment: California, Colorado, Illinois, New York, New Jersey and Washington. All other states are exempt from this requirement. If you cannot receive the COVID-19 vaccine because of a qualifying legal reason, you may request an exception to this requirement from the Company

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.00 - $30.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Rotating weekends

Application Question(s):

* What would be an appropriate way to check their responsiveness?

A. Shake their shoulders and ask, "Are you okay?"  
B. Loudly ask if they need help, without touching them  
C. Perform a sternum rub while calling their name loudly  
D. Gently spray water on their face and observe their reaction

* Which vital sign is likely documented incorrectly?

A. Blood pressure: 80/118 mmHg  
B. Respiratory rate: 18 breaths per minute  
C. Oxygen saturation (SpO2): 95%  
D. Pulse rate: 80 bpm  
E. Body temperature: 97.9°F

* You've been asked to take vitals for a patient.

Which vitals would you take?  
A. Blood pressure  
B. Respiratory rate  
C. Radial pulse  
D. Temperature  
E. Intake  
F. Output  
G. Weight  
H. Height

Experience:

* EMR systems: 1 year (Required)
* Vital signs: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Required)
* Certified Medical Assistant (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Princeton, NJ 08542 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Princeton, NJ 08542: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

description:

* 5+ years of operations management, business consulting, or related experience managing operations, building and developing diverse teams, optimizing processes, and delivering business goals.

title: Business Requirements Analyst
description:
At MVP Health Care, we’re on a mission to create a healthier future for everyone – which requires innovative thinking and continuous improvement. To achieve this, we’re looking for a Business Requirements Analyst to join #TeamMVP. If you have a passion for data, documentation and creating process efficiencies, this is the opportunity for you.
  
  

Full-Time, Exempt
  
  

**What’s in it for you:**  

* Growth opportunities to uplevel your career
* A people-centric culture embracing and celebrating diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences within our team
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits focused on well-being
* An opportunity to shape the future of health care by joining a team recognized as a Best Place to Work for and one of the Best Companies to Work For in New York


**Qualifications you’ll bring:**  

* A bachelor’s degree or equivalent in technical job experience preferred.
* The availability to work full-time and virtual.
* Comfortable working in a team environment as well as independently and possess a sense of accuracy and urgency in completing assignments.
* Adept at partnering with stakeholders to understand their processes and working with them to collaborate on solutions.
* Detail orientation with strong organizational skills
* High technical acumen, ability to quickly learn new systems and technologies


**Your key responsibilities:**  

* Assist Robotics Process Automation (RPA) and other non-RPA business area teams in gathering and building requirements documents.
* Read and write SQL queries, research/analyze data sources, and understand data flows.
* Create work items for new requests (intake process), uploading/maintaining the requirements document library, analyzing data and ensuring adherence to business process controls from each business area
* Set up and lead occasional process introduction and business area check in meetings
* Executes requirements tasks timely and escalates roadblocks to success to Leadership for resolution
* Ensure business teams are adhering to process in accordance with process requirements to satisfy audit requirements and assist with yearly audit as necessary.
* Contribute to our humble pursuit of excellence by performing various responsibilities that may arise, reflecting our collective goal of enhancing healthcare delivery and being the difference for the customer.


**Where you’ll be:**  

Virtual/remote role
  
  

Pay Transparency
  
At MVP, we are committed to providing competitive employee compensation and benefits packages. The base pay range provided for this role reflects our good faith compensation estimate at the time of posting. Specific employment offers and associated compensation will be made individually based on several factors, including but not limited to geographic location; relevant experience, education, and training; and the nature of and demand for the role.
  
  

Affirmative Action
  
MVP is an Affirmative Action/ Equal Employment Opportunity (PDF). We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other basis, e.g., Pay Transparency (PDF), and the Know your Rights protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Any person with a disability needing special accommodations to the application process, please contact Human Resources at hr@mvphealthcare.com.

title: Host
description:
*Perched sixty stories above Lower Manhattan, Manhatta serves seasonal, inspired cooking, and offers stunning views of New York City, its bridges, and waterways. Manhatta is a restaurant and full-service event space from Danny Meyer’s Union Square Hospitality Group, combining sky-high views with down-to-earth hospitality.*


**Who you are:**



The Host is a vital member of the Service team as the first impression and point of contact with every guest and visitor at the restaurant. The Host must exude warmth and hospitality and is a partner to the Maître D’ in plotting, planning, and updating the dining room to efficiently coordinate seatings throughout each service.


**What you’ll do:**


* Create a welcoming and hospitable environment for guests whether in person or over the phone.
* Partner with Maître D’ to quote accurate wait times while “finding the yes” for all guests.
* Properly answer guest inquiries with regards to restaurant hours of operation and basic operational information, menus, and reservations.
* Act as a liaison between the guest, management, service staff and kitchen and communicate accordingly.
* Work with efficiency and a sense of urgency while remaining composed.
* Demonstrates a passion for guest experience and an eagerness to learn and grow.
* Consistently support a culture of Enlightened Hospitality.


**What we need from you:**


* Experience in a guest facing role in a restaurant preferred, but not necessary
* Basic understanding of Resy functions
* Ability to walk or stand for long periods of time
* English fluency and additional languages preferred, but not required


**What you’ll get from us:**


* Hourly rate of $21 - $23/hr\\*
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
* Paid Time Off to support you with an active life outside of work
* Paid Parental Leave
* 51% dining discount throughout the USHG family of restaurants
* Flexible Spending Options (health care, dependent care, transit & parking)
* Employee Assistance Program to support overall mental wellbeing
* Exclusive access to primary care, mental health, and other healthcare services through Radish Health
* Matched 401(k) to help you invest in your future
* Generous Employee Referral Program
* Access to the USHG HUGS Employee Relief Fund


* The above represents the expected hourly range for this position. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

title: Resident Care Assistant / HHA – Part-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** with a skillset and a heart for helping residents make the most of each day. In this position, you'll be a friendly and familiar face to our residents, providing hands-on care in a respectful and dignified manner. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care you bring to the services you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
* Escorting residents to meals and recreational activities
* Supporting residents in achieving their highest level of physical, emotional and psycho-social well-being
* Helping out as needed in the Wellness area to ensure the safety, comfort and wellbeing of our residents
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness

**Qualifications:**

* NY-Certified Nursing Assistant, Personal Care Attendant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: LPN – Per Diem
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a compassionate and dedicated **LPN Supervisor** to oversee, mentor and nurture a team of nurses, HHA's, resident care aides and medication technicians in the busy Wellness/Resident Services Center of our luxury assisted living community. Acting as the shift supervisor in the absence of the Director, you will provide caring and attentive help to residents in managing their activities of daily living (ADLs) as well as in the administration of their medications — all while leading the team in caring for residents with skill and genuine kindness. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care and professionalism you bring to the services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Director of Wellness
* Must have staff supervisory and medication oversight experience, preferably in an assisted living, nursing home or similar environment
* You must have an active NY LPN certification and be driven by a genuine desire to improve the quality of life of our residents
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be caring, reliable and observant with an understanding of MAR's and doctors' orders
* It's essential to excel in prioritizing, multi-tasking and working independently

title: NJ Reflections Care Aide / HHA (Alzheimer's/Dementia Area) – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


Every year, more and more seniors experience memory loss. We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** who have a heart for senior care and can improve the quality of life of residents with Alzheimer's disease and dementia in our dedicated Reflections Memory Care Neighborhood. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The attention and understanding spirit that you bring helps to create a supportive environment for these residents, who, above all, need kindness, reassurance and genuine caring each day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
* Escorting residents to meals and recreational activities
* Helping out as needed in the Resident Services area to ensure the safety, comfort and wellbeing of our residents
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness

**Full-time schedule includes one weekend shift per week (Tues–Sat or Sun–Thurs).**

**Qualifications:**

* NJ-Certified Nursing Assistant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times

title: Waitstaff – Full-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking friendly, professional and, above all, compassionate **Waitstaff** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Patiently and cheerfully taking resident meal orders
* Checking station tables for settings and cleanliness
* Reading the menu before service so that you can knowledgeably assist the residents with their selections
* Assisting in the plating and proper portion controls of some or all of the following: appetizers, salads, soups, beverages and desserts
* Bussing tables at the end of the meal

**Must be able to work at least one weekend day per week (Tues–Sat).**


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Experience as a Waiter/Waitress in a restaurant or food-service-related industry
* Able to function in a fast-paced environment
* Have a strong ability to multi-task
* Possesses good communication, customer service and people skills
* Is professional, patient and able to satisfy a demanding customer base
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Is a team player, willing to help out where needed to ensure a pleasurable dining experience
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

* NJ-Certified Nursing Assistant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times

title: NJ Reflections Care Aide/HHA (Alzheimer's/Dementia Area) – Per Diem
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


Every year, more and more seniors experience memory loss. We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** who have a heart for senior care and can improve the quality of life of residents with Alzheimer's disease and dementia in our dedicated Reflections Memory Care Neighborhood. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. * Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times

Acting as the shift supervisor in the absence of the Director, you will provide caring and attentive help to residents in managing their activities of daily living (ADLs) as well as in the administration of their medications — all while leading the team in caring for residents with skill and genuine kindness. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care and professionalism you bring to the services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Director of Wellness
* Must have staff supervisory and medication oversight experience, preferably in an assisted living, nursing home or similar environment
* You must have an active NY LPN certification and be driven by a genuine desire to improve the quality of life of our residents
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be caring, reliable and observant with an understanding of MAR's and doctors' orders
* It's essential to excel in prioritizing, multi-tasking and working independently

title: Waitstaff- Per Diem
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


One of the strengths that sets The Bristal apart as a luxury assisted living community is our chef-prepared cuisine and the country club dining experience we provide three times a day. We are seeking friendly, professional and, above all, compassionate **Waitstaff** with the kind, patient and cheerful spirit to deliver on that exceptional experience. You know the satisfied feeling you get at an upscale restaurant when the servers do an excellent job? That's the same feeling we wish our residents to have every day, and as part of our Waitstaff team, your performance is key to making that happen. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring all meals are served and presented in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Food Service. The loving care, attention and great customer service you bring to the dining experience are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Patiently and cheerfully taking resident meal orders
* Checking station tables for settings and cleanliness
* Reading the menu before service so that you can knowledgeably assist the residents with their selections
* Assisting in the plating and proper portion controls of some or all of the following: appetizers, salads, soups, beverages and desserts
* Bussing tables at the end of the meal


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* Experience as a Waiter/Waitress in a restaurant or food-service-related industry
* Able to function in a fast-paced environment
* Have a strong ability to multi-task
* Possesses good communication, customer service and people skills
* Is professional, patient and able to satisfy a demanding customer base
* Experience working with a senior population is preferred, but not required
* Is a team player, willing to help out where needed to ensure a pleasurable dining experience
* Familiarity with food safety, food preparation and board of health guidelines is a plus
* Is able to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in actions and demeanor
* Maintains an abiding respect for the elderly and remains calm at all times

title: NJ Medication Aide – Per Diem
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Medication Aides/Technicians** to help our residents in the daily management of their medication. Working in our Resident Services Wellness Department, your assistance is key in helping residents take their medications safely, consistently and as directed by their physicians. This is a key area where our residents count on reliable support, and your attention to detail and disciplined approach will make a positive impact on their lives. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The attentive and loving care you bring to the medication services you provide are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) and the administration of their medications
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness
* Ensuring the safety and wellbeing of all residents, while following company policies and procedures
* Following Medication Administration Records (MAR) and doctors' orders

**Qualifications:**

* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times
* Extremely reliable, dependent and observant
* Ability to work one weekend day per week
* Must have at least an HHA certificate
* Solid understanding of MAR's and doctors' orders a plus (but we will train the right individual)
* Applicants must hold a New Jersey state med aide certification in order to apply for this position

title: Filing Clerk
company: Achieve Beyond Pediatric Therapy and Autism Services
description:
**Our Ideal Candidate Filing Clerk:**

* Are you detail-oriented and organized? Know how to manage different types of information? Want to work for a company that has a strong mission of helping children with special needs?


If this sounds like you, please apply today!


Founded in 1995, Achieve Beyond nationally meets the needs of children by providing the highest quality of pediatric therapy and autism services. Our providers and administrative staff are dedicated to our mission of helping children and families and we are looking for smart, innovative, and driven candidates to join our team. Achieve Beyond is centered around our culture of collaboration and support to ensure our services are of the highest quality and adhere to our strong ethical standards.

**Job Summary**:


The Filing Clerk will manage the records, documents, and files for our child service cases. The Filing Clerk will help manage a high-volume filing system, ensuring accurate and updated records on a daily basis.


The Filing Clerk will use documentation software such as Adobe Acrobat, MS Outlook, as well as our database to manage all necessary paperwork and information. In addition, this individual will be responsible for scanning, and working with electronic and paper files in addition to other administration responsibilities

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Create and maintain filing system (electronic and physical)
* Scan session notes
* Assist other departments with session notes request
* Assist during department audits and special projects as needed
* Perform audits to ensure session notes are completed with accuracy
* Other duties as assigned by manager

**Our Mission**: We believe that all children have potential. We are guided by the mission to support children with special needs to Achieve Beyond their current abilities. We are always striving for continuous improvement by setting goals and measuring performance. It is the reason we will succeed together.

**Physical Requirements of the Role:**

* Occasionally ascends/descends stairs going to, while at, or leaving work location or facilities traveled to for work events.
* Must be able to remain in a stationary position for prolonged periods of time up to 90% of the workday working on a computer/electronic device.
* The ability to communicate information and ideas so others will understand. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.

**Benefits Include:**

* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage, and 401 with employer match
* Short- and long-term disability coverage as well as life, flex spending, and commuter benefits
* Paid time off, sick time, and holiday pay
* Various Employee Discounts on Entertainment and Equipment
* Educational reimbursement and referral bonuses
* Structured initial training.
* Monthly administrative events and so much more!
* **Compensation:** Full-time hourly non-exempt $18-18.50 per hour
* **Hours:** Monday-Friday 9:00 am-5:30 pm Must Be Willing To Work Overtime As Needed. This position is in office.

**Job Description is Subject to Change.**

***This job description is subject to change at any time.***
------------------------------------------------------------

***Achieve Beyond provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type regarding race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, caregiver status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. If you are an individual with a disability requesting accommodation for the application process, please contact us for assistance.***
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
